Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location, but some things one needs to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: ANTONIOZ
Reviews.Content: Good points first: - Very convenient location, close to both U-Bahn and S-bahn stations, to the Tegel 109 bus route, and 6-7 minutes on foot to the 200 bus that tourists need the most. - Plenty of good restaurants nearby, and all the boutiques and shops of the Kudamm within a short walk. The flagship KaDeWe store is not far away. - Reasonable-sized, modern rooms, with the two most important things one really needs in a hotel - an excellent bed and an excellent bathroom with a big shower. - Plentiful breakfast included in the rate Less good: - No minibar and no personal safe in the room - One side of the hotel faces a very busy raliway track: double-glazing and soundproofing are pretty good, but one needs to be on Fourth Floor or above. On no account accept First Floor rooms: It is like having a train run across the top of one's head. - In-room Wifi (which is free) was patchy on our IPad, though better on a more powerful portable PC. - The plentiful breakfast includes as a daily staple great lumps of clod-like scrambled egg, which seem to be the product of an artificial egg-powder. Reminiscent of post WW2 rationing days, but here and now in 2012?? Really! And is it vital to offer the use of cheap black plastic trays - they do create a canteen atmosphere. Conclusion: - A superior budget hotel. Functional, convenient, good value, but in the highly competitive Berlin hotel scene, I would try somewhere else on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Ahouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance from U Bahn and S Bahn stations so excellent access to the town and it’s surroundings. The rooms are small but comfortable, just missing a safe and fridge. Make sure to request a room facing the courtyard as the outside can be noisy due to the S Bahn meters away from the building or the traffic in front of the hotel. But hey what do you expect from a hotel in the city. Breakfast can be a bit hectic too make sure you have time and are not in a rush than everything is fine as the food will continue to be supplied…

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and great location”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuyMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in late March during a 2 week vacation in Europe. The hotel was fantastic and was in a great location, less than a block from numerous restaurants and upscale shops. Also it is just a few blocks from the Zoo where you can catch the train, subway and bus. Breakst was included a plentiful. Rooms are good size and modern. I read previous reviews about noise from the train, but fr us, it was part of the charm! HINT- the hotel has a printed list of local restaurants. We were not disappointed in the ones we used. Staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “A smart choice to visit Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Mitradventures
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a very short city trip to Berlin (3 days and a half) and opted for the Hampton hotel. I did not really know what to expect and wondered whether this hotel would actually carry the Hilton name properly... well, I got the answer very quickly: YES. Here are some of the highlights: 1. location: the hotel is very close to the subway and bus stop (about 1 min walk) and from the train station (about 5 min), so it is very easy to come from the airport using public transportation. It is also very conveniently located in a nice shopping area (close to KaDeWe for department store style, but also with loads of small designer boutiques in cute little streets close by...). Finally, location wise, there are also many many restaurants of different styles withing walking distance. 2. the room: not too small and very nicely furnished. Very modern and ultra clean bathroom with hairdrier. If I want to be picky, I would say that they should add a small safe in the room, but that's about it. Free internet is the icing on the cake. 3. Food: the Hampton offers a very nice and complete breakfast. We arrived 10 minutes before it closed once, but that was absolutely no problem. The hotel also had a nice little bar which comes in handy when you want to recover from a very long day of walking in Berlin. the Hampton does not have a restaurant for diner, BUT has a list of about 10 recommended restaurants in the vicinity that they recommend (with different styles). We tested two of them and loved it. 4. My Hilton moment - the staff: overall I must say that ALL the staff we interacted with was really nice and helpful. As a Hilton Honors member, I was contacted by email prior to our arrival to see if I needed help to prepare our trip. The email signature did mention that there was a 24-hour guest service, and that was true (I replied to one of the emails at the wee hours of the day and got a reply within 30 minutes....). If I have to mention one staff in particular, it would be Phuong Nguyen Thanh who really made our stay extra nice. He helped with restaurant bookings, but most importantly, when we had to check out at 4.30 am, he helped with booking our airport transfer and ensured that lunch boxes would be ready as well... I am sure I am missing some elements but you get the point... I really recommend this hotel for an enjoyable visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Higher calls than Hamptons”
Reviews.Author: ItalyClaudio
Reviews.Content: This hotel belongs to the Hilton chain, and usually Hampton are a step below the classical Hilton. This is not the case for this hotel, new, with big and well furnished rooms, free internet, a good and rich breakfast and close to the subway to move rapidly and easily around in Berlin. I would suggest this hotel, no doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MCOOL2010
Reviews.Content: Okay, first off, this hotel is flanked by two streets that start with the letter K. Realize this early on and avoid alot of headache, because the train is along one of them and not the other. I didn't realize this and ended up going to opposite direction every day we were there. The hotel is great. We drove in and their parking lot was full, but they directed us down the street to one literally a 5 minute drive, and it was only 10 euros a day to park there. We left it there 3 days and it was just fine when we went to pick it up. Its about a 10 minute walk to the train S Bahn (if you're going in the right direction) but also going in the opposite direction led us to a bunch of regular stores, a huge valley of stores which was very necessary as we were all ill prepared for the weather. Its a 15 minute ride to east berlin, and its a very safe place to be walking about, lots of restaraunts close by. A pigeon hit me in the head. Anyways, the breakfast was the best. Its so generous, juice, coffee, tea, cereal, bacon, eggs, pancakes, cheese, sausages, bread, yogurts. And plenty of space in their bar/ area to eat. Front staff were very nice and accomdating, answered all of our questions and understood and spoke pretty good english. If I return to Berlin (which I won't but has nothing to do with the hotel, more the lack of culture) I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Raphael823
Reviews.Content: First rate, especially the room and location. Amazing breakfast and the staff make the stay absoulutely great. I won't stay anywhere else...and I got to Germany every year.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: steen-odense
Reviews.Content: New hotel situated only a few meters from Kurfürstendamm and Gedächtniskirche (although this is undergoing renovation right now) - so shopping is plenty! The hotel was surprisingly good for the price, except for a missing safe we could find nothing to complain about. Starting with the service and help for finding a cheap parking garage near the hotel at check-in. For giving our family two rooms next to each other, which is by no means standard. Excellent included hot/cold breakfast with bacon, eggs, bread, fresh fruit etc. Nice rooms with fine beds and bedding. Nice bar and seating area next to but secluded from the reception. And free WIFI not to forget. And the staff was smiling and helpful at all times during our three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: globezipper
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at probably >15 different Hampton Inns over the years. This is the best of them. The place looks brand new, the rooms are spotless clean and reasonably large. Breakfast is good, much better than at any of the Hampton Inns in the US. There is a nice bar at the hotel as well - although - hey, let's face it - there are gazillions of cool bars just around the corner :-) Location is predictably great - you're smack in the middle of what used to be West Berlin. Train station (Zoologischer Garten) is max 10 minute walk, I did it in less. If you come "home" after a hard night, or if you have a very early flight, then it's good to know that there's a cafe (Schwarzes Cafe, a real institution for decades) around the corner that serves breakfast 24 hrs per day. Just one thing. When the weather is nice, you can rent bicycles. But go there early, because there are not many of them, and they get rented out fast. In a nutshell, great place. If you want to go to this corner of Berlin, then stay there. I've stayed here twice before, but this is the first time I'm reviewing it. Excellent value, I thought really hard but can't think of anything negative about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: GabsJL
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, close to everything and to all transport. Very clean and modern with reasonably-sized rooms. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, whether at the front desk, at breakfast or at the bar. The rates are a very good deal for the quality of the hotel. Will return to thes hotel without a moment's hesitation on any future trips to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel convenient to Berlin centre”
Reviews.Author: DeniseC76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, new and exceptionally clean! The only downside was that the room was on the small side - we had a family room which was a double bed and a sofa bed. However, as everything else was of excellent standard for the price being charged, I won't hold this against it!! The breakfast was included and was also excellent - everything from any cereal you wanted, hot rolls and different breads, fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, muesli, bacon and eggs to pancakes, ham and cheeese!! It was also close to the Zoo Station which was about 8 mins walk away and you could get to anywhere in Berlin from there. There is also plenty of restaurants near the hotel also - Savigny Platz and Kurfustendam St recommended for same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: markdroitwich
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms here for a group of friends in March 2012. We all thought the hotel offers excellent value... newly built, clean rooms, comfy beds, with added bonus of free wifi and a great buffet breakfast. Hotel is well located, within easy walking distance of two U Bahn stations and the Zoo mainline station which takes you directly to the airport for about 3 Euros ! Plenty of great places to eat and drink within 10 minutes walk of the hotel, and great shopping on the nearby K-Damm. The reception staff at this hotel are particularly friendly.... Florian and crew were were very helpful with anything we needed. I was a bit dubious about the potential noise from the nearby railway track.... don't let it put you off... we had a room right next to the tracks, and with all the double glazing, the noise is hardly noticeable. All in all, we had a great stay here, and we would all definitely choose this hotel if in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - Excellent location and services”
Reviews.Author: Reiner S
Reviews.Content: It's been a week since I returned from Berlin and I am still thinking about the great stay I had at the Hampton by Hilton Berlin City West. But what makes it so special ? Nothing but the friendly and professional staff at the Front Desk, the Bar and the Restaurant; the hotel was very busy during the whole week due to ITB (Tourism Trade Show) but no matter how busy things got, the staff would always have a genuine smile, a kind, attentive and professional treatment for each one of the guests. I have stayed in other hotels in Berlin and all throughout Germany but never ever I felt so welcome and at home as I felt here. Florian, Lina, Naemi, Tomasso and Phuong at the Front Desk as well as Torsten and Marvin at the Bar made it special and marked a difference at the Hampton, the Management must be very proud for having such a great staff. The property is fairly new with comfortable rooms and basically everything you may need while on a business trip, a plus is that you receive complimentary Internet access for each one of your devices and you can enjoy a hearty breakfast every morning with a greta selection of hot and cold options and all that for free. Location couldn´t be better ! The hotel is close to many Kudam Street (Kurfüsterdam), the Zoologischer Garten, S and U-Bahn stations, the famous KaDeWe Department store and many others. No doubt this will be my preferred hotel for my next trip to Berlin, a place where I will feel at home and see the old folks !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price”
Reviews.Author: GVA_lmb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in perfect location. It has prices below 100E per night in the business season. It is close to the train station and offers good breakfast in the room price. If going back to Berlin would consider the hotel for sure in business and for city break.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: watchdogBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The benefit of this hotel is its location. It is next to the Bond Street of Berlin where you can find not only the best clothes and cosmetics but also faboulous food, tour buses and great furniture. The hotel itself hits all the buttons of classic hospitality, effieciency and cleanliness with the expected standard of bed and bathroom. Northing unusual or undesirable. Pleasant standard Hilton quality healthy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Maryam-Tmd
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable room and great location (near the shopping area, restaurants, subway, etc) at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: The Hampton hotel is a great choice for Berlin. There's excellent service for a reasonable price. The room was nicely decorated, the bathroom was rather spacious. There was free wifi in the room. There's complimentary breakfast in the room price. Breakfast was great with a rather big choice of food (ham, cheese, different eggs, pancakes,bacon, yoghurts, müski etc) just as it should be! Staff is one of the friendliest hotel staff I've ever experienced. Also the location is very good, with a metro and s-bahn station really not far away. I would definitly recommend this hotel and will for sure go back to the Hampton next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hptel near ( really close as at) Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: ieasabel
Reviews.Content: Located near Ku'damm. Near U1 subway line and about 9km from tegel ( from BER 20 km). Nice modern hotel to stay in. Nearly renovated I think. Good pleasant staff and room service. Small but nice gym. Wifi and breakfast was included and I think it is always in price ( I had on hilton.com page no possibility of booking without breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: Located close to Kurfürstendamm and the Tiergarten, this is a new hotel with all commodities and good service. Metro station is within 5min walking distance and train station 10min. Reaching Alexanderplatz takes around 30min by metro. Rooms are spacious, up to Hilton standard - modern furniture, medium-size TV flat screen. Kettle, coffee and tea are provided in the room as well as all bathrooms amenities. Breakfast is quite modest (with the basics: coffee, tea, fruit salad, yogurt, bread, cheese and ham) - probably the only drawback we can point out. Free WiFi is available in the room. They give tips about restaurants nearby - check the brochure in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with very friendly service staff”
Reviews.Author: Roman P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite new so the interior is up to date and quite good looking. You can reach the Kurfürstendamm, KaDeWe and Hardrock Cafe by feet. The breakfast is a little bit unconventional, because you have to put your bf onto a tray like in a cafeteria. But quality was good. S-Bahn and U-Bahn is close around. There are parking places at the hotel or public garages nearby the hotel. Overall I woul stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly ambiance”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: The staff at front desk were very friendly, all speaking good english. Hotel inviting and cosy atmosphere. Hotel and room very clean. Breakfast was tasty and good selection of food. Sausage, bacon and eggs to cold meats and cheese slices. I would highly recommend this hotel for its atmosphere and location. The hotel is situated near a main shopping street and 5 min walk to zoo staion which takes you direct to most places including shonefeld airport. Nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good reasonably priced hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: FluffyB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really good value and a great location, just off the Kurfurstendam. Staff were exceptionally helpful, rooms really clean, great shower and nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and caring”
Reviews.Author: horlix1955
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with my family for four nights. All of the staff on the front desk were very caring and helpful. i have minimal German, yet they answered all travel queries patiently and in detail in fluent English. When we came in they always gave a greeting; nothing including picking up emails was too much of a problem The room was amazingly clean. The bed with lovely soft pillows had just the right amount of firmness. The breakfast buffet offered a range of hot and cold foods and it was easy to sit there for an hour or so just letting time pass by. In the evening the bar area was relaxing and drinks not overly priced. Well recommended i will come back again when i return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: courtney k
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, walking distance from most of the attractions, the staff is friendly and the room was very nice and comfortable. We will come back. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “One of the best deals you can get in the western part of the city”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereAlready_12
Reviews.Content: Hampton by Hilton hardly compares to the Hampton Inns U.S. travellers may be familiar with. It’s not a motel off a busy autobahn but a full-fledged hotel located right in the middle of Berlin’s western centre, close to shabby Bahnhof Zoo and the posh shops on Kurfürstendamm. This part of town has been forgotten somehow in recent years when all the attention focused on Berlin-Mitte. But with the Waldorf Astoria to open soon this area is likely to get an injection with some new energy. I have stayed at the Hampton Berlin on a number of occasions on business as it caters for everything you need whilst in the city. Beds are extremely comfy, rooms are clean and efficient, there’s a gym in the basement (leaving the road warrior with no excuses for not working out), and on top of that they thrown in a decent breakfast without an additional charge. Except for peak times during trade fairs (Berlin Messe is just three S-Bahn stops away) their rates are normally well below 100 Euros per night. This is one of the best deals you can get around Kurfürstendamm. Staff are highly competent, always friendly and helpful. In particular, I’d like to single out Ms Stangl and Mr Gabriel who do a great job at the front desk. While the location is central and public transport is nearby, the “sound of city” is all around and in particular the rooms facing the railroads can be noisy, even if the sound insulation is generally good. But if you like to sleep with the windows wide open you’d rather make sure to get a room facing the backyard already when making the booking. I give the hotel a top rating as an inexpensive business hotel. For a romantic weekend, I would rather shop for special deals at one of Berlin’s many five star places. When checking out on Fridays I often saw busses unload herds of tourist, chiefly form Scandinavia. Well, if you know their drinking habits…

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: godiva2012
Reviews.Content: The staff here is well trained and very friendly. The rooms are clean, fresh, comfortable and feature free wifi. The buffet style breakfast is plentiful, and features a nice variety of food. The rooms have a tea kettle/boiler which is very important for those who wish to make tea. The rooms offer a nice variety of teas and coffees.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: anthony z
Reviews.Content: It was a great trip the hotel and the staff are nice. The location is very convenient and the area is packed with restaurants and bars. The main commercial street is pretty close of the hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who would enjoy the city. Not only as couple but also with friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in this centrally located hotel in Berlin and fully satisfied with my choice. Location of hotel is very close to 'city sightseeing' bus route and one can see all major attractions of Berlin in a very convenient and affordable way making it an ideal tourist hotel. On business front hotel has nice spacious bedrooms with excellent bed, bath and other amenities including complimentary tea coffee facility. This is the only hotel I have stayed where the reception staff asked on its own if I wanted to use complimentary wi-fi service on one or more devices and provided two sets of passwords for the same. The quality of complimentary breakfast was good with lots of chooices. The reception staff was very helpful in providinf all informations and generous in offering extended check out period up to 2 pm without any fuss. Whenever in Berlin again, Hampton is going to be my choice again without second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round, only drawback is the railway”
Reviews.Author: TykeTraveller1987
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, great breakfast buffet. Excellent location, U and S bahn stations both close Nice rooms, clean and warm. A railway runs along one side of the hotel - get a room the other side or your sleep will be disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Berlin at Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Alex H
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a weekend in the Hampton in Berlin. Very fresh hotel and it looked quite new. Very friendly check-in and the room was excellent and well apointed. Bed was just to my liking. Was affraid that the S-bahn just outside would make a lot of noice, but the hotel must be very well isolated because I didnt hear a sound. The location at Uhlandstrasse is perfect. Savignyplatz just on the next ampel with its s-bahn station and bars/restaurants, and in the other direction bahnhof zoo. No problems getting anywhere in Berlin from there. Definatly my choice for my next Berlin visit as well!

Reviews.Title: “What a great new place”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff at check in , room with balcony was very clean , spacious and inviting. Breakfast selection was great .Location was perfect so close to transport and restaurants. I would stay here again if ever in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “First German Hampton - love it!”
Reviews.Author: Niccolonia
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in late December and was curious about the first German Hampton. I’m a frequent guest at the US Hampton Inns and it was nice to find a few familiar things here as well. The central location just metres from the Kurfuerstendamm is unbeatable if you are on a city trip. If you can avoid it don’t bring a car; everything is in walking distance and although the hotel offers parking for a reasonable price the available spots are very limited. Only 15 if I counted right. There are two other parking garages not too far away. The rooms are rather small but furnished very effectively; for example a sliding door either closes the bathroom or the closet. The closet is not big either but worked out fine for me; if you have a lot of luggage the space might become a little cramped. The bathroom could need a bit more storing space but was great other than that: nice shower, lots of towels, powerful hair dryer, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, everything was there. Comfortable queen-size bed; my room also had a sofa and a desk; internet is included which is not that common in Germany. Just before New Year’s the hotel was packed but I didn’t hear anything from other guests in the neighboring rooms or in the hallway; no banging doors or anything like that. With closed windows there is also absolutely no disturbance from the very close railway. Breakfast is included and offers a great selection of everything one could wish for. Extra kudos to the breakfast staff, they really did an amazing job. Seemed that all guests were there at the same time; actually the only time where you realized the hotel was fully booked. But they refilled everything quickly, extra rooms were opened so that everybody could find a seating spot and on top they were super friendly all the time. I wish I could send the breakfast people from my favorite Hampton in Myrtle Beach for training, they could learn so much here! This will be my second home whenever I’m in Berlin from now on. Hope there will be more Hamptons in Germany soon.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel near Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: ksiazemati
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the street near the BMW salon on Ku'damm. So really great for shopping and visiting restaurants. Nuear u bahn station ) the last on west of no U1 line). It is 9 km from TXL so when BBI will be opened it will take more to get here. It is good chain hotel chioce in Berlin, better than Mercure and Best Western hotels in Berlin. The rooms are ok, like renovated and as always the same in Hampton hotels. The staff was very friendly. There is gym but no pool. The wifi and breakfast are complimentary. The staff was helpful and really quick working. I really recomend!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mf2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last Christmas, nice, clean spacious room, in great location, neat metro station and just 10 minutes walking from Zoo bus station where 100 and 200 buses terminate and which are very convenient to see the city. Nice breakfast. The only bad moment was when the concierge girl was very reluctant to help us with a restaurant reservation. In fact she lied saying that it waw fully booked, but when we called, there were plenty tables available. Over all good impression, and good prices. Also a little careless with the towels, not every day chenged.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located off Ku’dam and is a 5 to 10 minute walk from the closest stop that you get off at if you are using the Airport bus to get into the city. There are some train tracks running (overhead) close to the hotel, but our room was on the side not facing the tracks. So I can’t speak for the rooms closer to the tracks. The room was fairly small, but ok for two people. One complaint had we had was that the wifi connection was very spotty and would support only one device. The front desk was helpful when we had questions for them, and gave us some great recommendations of places of interest as well. The breakfast was standard, but very efficient considering that the hotel was almost full thanks to the Christmas/NYs holidays. There are lots of restaurants around, atms, and is about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the closest Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, simple and clean; Free Wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Shiyu L
Reviews.Content: about 300 hundred meters to the U-Bahn and 500 to the S-Bahn. Room are simple but clean, no safes in my room which is why i rated it as only 4/5. When checked in, I was upgraded to a nice room on the top floor and away from the train tracks, so it was pretty quiet during the night. The room rates includes the wifi and breakfast, although the breakfast was not very attractive. The location is very good and near to the S-Bahn Zoological Garden, ideal if you want to travel to Potsdam for a day trip, the S7 departs every 10-15 minutes from the S-Bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good experience!”
Reviews.Author: xGabizinhax
Reviews.Content: It's definitely a great hotel, wonderful location, in a walking distance from the zoo and main subway and bus station. You're just 5 minutes from the 100 bus line, which takes you straight to the Bundestag and the Brandenburg Gate. The staff couldn't be more friendly - while we were unpacking I was asked if it was my first time in Berlin, and after my "no", I was presented to a city map, showing me the best places to visit and also referring good places to spend the new year's eve. The suggestions where really helpful! Also, as the room had no fridge, they were happy to cool our two bottles of beer and one bottle of champagne on their bar fridge, before we went out on the 31st eve. The room was great, not so large, but good for a couple. The breakfast was amazingly good, with a broad option of breads, yogurts and other fresh items. My only advice is to make sure you get a room apart from the train tracks, which are located on the right side of the hotel - they already did it for us before I asked, so we got a great silent room on the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Lexielegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit the zoo, which is within walking distance. The rooms were lovely and the staff were VERY friendly. They were great with our 5 year old!! The rooms were large and comfortable. The breakfast was amazing, we certainly ate our fill. A great location, very close to the zoo, Kerfustendam and all the designed shops. Very handy for the bus and underground stops. Loads of bars, cafes and restaurants nearby, also a supermarket for those late night snacks. This was our second time to Berlin, and if we go again, we'd would certainly stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and staff”
Reviews.Author: Maccaroo
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Berlin is only a year or so old, and situated just a block off former West Berlin's "Magnificent Mile" the Ku-Damm in Berlin Charlottenburg. In walking distance to the zoo, and zoo train station as well as the KaDeWe the hotel offers free breakfast and a nice bar/lounge area. The upper floors offer a pretty street and/or skyline view. Rooms are clean, and the wireless access was more than sufficient. The staff was super friendly, and I would like to point out the great attitude and professionalism of Florian, Birk at the front desk plus of Torsten the bartender. Thanks guys - see you in 2012

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Bavarianride
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not hard to find, and its new - the first Hampton Inn in Germany. It is sparkling clean from the moment you walk in, all the way to your room. The rooms are spotless, and very well equipped with power outlets (some hotels in Europe are extremely stingy with power outlets). Reading lights on each side of the queen size beds if you wish to read without blinding your partner. All rooms have a cube radio/clock with alarm. We were initially placed in rooms on the first floor looking directly at a railroad line, and we could see every single train that entered or left Berlin - and there are a LOT of trains every few seconds!. Although the windows are triple glazed, you can still feel the vibration and a mild distant 'light rumble' from trains, so we asked to be changed to rooms not facing the rail line. The front desk changed us with no problem. All of the rooms have showers, so if you're wanting a bath tub, this is not you're hotel. The hot water in the showers is instant and strong, no waiting for the water to warm up. The shower and sink have pumper type soap, shampoo and conditioner with a nice smell, but we still prefer to take our own. The TV's are flat screen HD with a broad selection of channels, and several English channels. You can also select the "language" from the menu. The staff at this hotel is remarkably well trained, and very prepared to serve their guests, and every problem is solvable. You don't get a strangle look, or the feeling that you're annoying the staff with ANY question or request you have. We drove to the hotel and parked in their underground parking garage - 12 euros per day (reasonable by Berlin standards, since most charge nearly twice that much). They don't hassle you with the 24hr rule for parking - big asset. There is bike rentals directly outside the door to the hotel. You can rent by paying the front desk - super convenient. We rented the 2 remaining bikes (8 euros per bike for 4hrs) but they don't hassle you or nickle and dime for slight overtime usage. The breakfast buffet at this hotel is incredible for an economy hotel - it far exceeds the breakfast you find at Hampton's stateside. But the breakfast area gets ultra busy at peak times 9am - 10am. Despite the jam packed dining area, the staff was always monitoring the food and replenishing, and also opening up overflow dining areas to accomodate everyone. There is a small fitness center in the basement, with a few pieces of workout equipment and dumbbells. There's a bathroom, sink, and large water bottle w/cups along with fresh apples and towels. Access to the elevator, gym and other facilities requires a room key for control - good feature. The bathrooms near the bar are surprisingly sparkling clean, so someone is doing a great job keeping the place tidy. The bar is almost an extension of the check-in desk, so you can order a drink at anytime. The staff at this hotel is young, ultra friendly, extremely well informed, and know the city to provide directions to sights, or for making recommendations regarding public transportion. The hotel is located near two key subways stops, bus terminals, and tram stops, giving you access to the whole city. This is one of the best economy hotels I've ever stayed in and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants a great night's rest in a large comfortable bed, in a clean, safe environment, good location, and with terrific support from the staff, for a very reasonable price - we payed 80euros for a double. It rivals the service of a 5 star hotel without the luxury or expense, but it exceeds the service and comfort you expect from many 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: rtd3_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Close to train station and walking distance to downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but if you are noise sensitive, choose garden view rooms”
Reviews.Author: VaryaI
Reviews.Content: This is the first Hampton by Hilton in Germany, 1 year operational. Front desk agents are helpful, knowledgeable and attentive. Breakfast is good and rich, minding that this is a limited service hotel. Room was clean and pleasant. Next time I would choose the garden view rooms as I was able to hear trains (railway is nearby one of the hotel' wall). Also, the bottle of water in the room was highly desired for those who are hesitant to drink tap water which is safe in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Great stuff”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled186605
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hapmton Hilton for 4 nights. Great breakfast, clean and comfortable room and super value, Its also a good location for gettinfd around. But the real icing on the cake was the ever friendly, helpful and informative staff.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: thePhotoDude812
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this Hotel and was very pleased. Room was fairly large for one person and very clean. Bed was comfortable with large pillows and of large size. Bathroom was nicely designed with a hot and powerfull shower. Nothing to complain. Rooms are well sound proofen, no elevator noises or closing doors from the hallway. Even though the street in front of the hotel was crowded my room was quiet. If you are really picky, you might hear the passing trains of the railway track next to the hotel, but from my room it was not disturbing at all. Most minibar refrigerators inside the room are louder. Room itself featured everything you wish for, Flat-TV, electric kettle for tea, flat iron, Free-high speed Wlan und a comfortable sofa to rest on. Service in the hotel was very friendly and ready to help. Check-in and -out was fast. For the price I paid for the room I was pretty happy with the room and completely suprised about the included breakfast. It was really awesome. Lots of fresh products, even pancakes. Rolls, all kinds of cereals and fresh fruit. The breakfastroom itself could use a few more seats, I had to wait a few minutes to get a table, but compared to pricier Hotels it still was more than OK. The Hotel itself is conveniently located close to the Kurfürstenstraße and fairly close to the highways. By car all parts of downtown Berlin are easy to reach. The only two negatives - if they are negativ at all - would be the lack of a wardrobe in the room. A small shelf or something in addition to the existing cupboard would be great for smaller apparel. And as a second point the obviously limited amount of parking spaces in the Hotel. When I arrived it was already full - at 6 pm. But thanks to the friendly stuff I parked my car across the street at Stilwerk´s parkinglot, which was a good hint. 10 Euros for 24h is a good price for Berlin and the carpark is well lit and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: LouAnnK
Reviews.Content: Usually, for our modest budget, European hotels are sparse and basic. This hotel exceeds all of our expectations, even for U.S. standards. Great, safe location, very clean, cozy and spacious rooms, awesome shower, extras like FREE hot breakfast and soap/shampoo/conditioner/lotion. Naemi, the night front desk lady needs a promotion. She spoke perfect English, and was more than willing to help us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Berlin Shopping”
Reviews.Author: tomasztomczuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights in August, booking it through Opodo and using 20 EUR/night discount coupon, so it came up to be about 50 EUR per night, at this rate it is impossible to find a hotel in Berlin in such a premier location. The hotel is a 20 minute/ 15 Euro ride from the Tegel Airport. The first impression was that the hotel is next to the train tracks and it will be impossible to rest at night. Quick check in and a friendly chat with the staff, the ground floor is simple and doesn't impress at all, there are three computer stations that are free to use by the guests. At the front deskt be asked for a room on a higher floor to be possibly as far from the train tracks as possible, what we got was a mid-size room with two large beds and a balcony you could walk out on and check out all the different trains passing by the hotel. At night, with closed windows you could not hear a thing, except the A/C fan. The people at the front desk were extremly nice, offeref several maps of the city of Berlin, told us what to see and what to omit during our short two day stay. The breakfast included with the rate is sufficient, with cold and hot choice, a good start of a day that saves you a couple of EUR. The hotel is a 200 meter walk from the Kurfürstendamm Street with all the high street shops, starting from Polo Ralph Lauren and ending with LV or Gucci. The public buses run every minute to almost every location of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a budget property should be”
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: I did a night at the Hampton in Berlin last Saturday and was hugely impressed. It is basically everything that you would want from a hotel on a leisure or one-night stay with none of the stuff you don't need (business centre, restaurant, car parking etc). The room was identical to the one on the website, with a smart bathroom as well. Substantially better than you get in, say, a Holiday Inn Express in the UK. Tea and coffee facilities were provided. As a Hilton Gold I got a room on the top floor with a small balcony. The breakfast was also far ahead of the HI Express UK version, with a broader range and better hot products. Hilton Gold members can also claim a free bottle of water and your choice of snack / choco bar from the bar. Internet - free (free to all, not just me as a HH Gold). This is a real selling point now that more people are carrying tablets with them. The only shocking downer was when my wife rang the hotel for a 20 minute chat with me. I was charged Euro 33 for receiving the call!!! However, it is my own fault as I should have known the charge would be horrendous. It is a sign of how much I liked the hotel that I still give it a five-star rating despite this! One tip - when coming out of Uhlandstrasse U-bahn, you want to be on the side of the Ku'damm where the White & Case building is. If you are on the 'Cinema Paris' side then you are on the wrong stretch of Uhlandstrasse and need to cross Ku'damm.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Yichen L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was between 2 S-bahn : "Zoologischer Garten" and "Savignyplatz" and took about 5 minutes walk from each station. Very friendly frondesk stuff. The room looked just like the website. New, clean, and comfortable. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kev10kop_10
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - would not hesitate to stay there again. Very close to the main shopping street and also very close to a square with a good choice of restaurants. Our room was modern and comfortable (brilliant pillows), breakfast had an excellent choice and the reception staff were lovely and very helpful. One lovely girl on reception offered us her home-made biscuits each evening. Must go to Dickie Wertin Bar/Restaurant (German) for a great atmosphere and good german food also fab tapas restaurant on main shopping street. Xmas markets were magical.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceegb2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was closer to the main shopping area that we though, which was great. The hotel itself was very modern, clean and spacious. Staff were very friendly. Rooms were a good size and larger than some (more expensive) hiltons I've stayed in the past. Also very quiet rooms. Wifi very good and free. The cost was £80/nt inc breadfast which I though was excellent value. Bar prices were very good too and the measures very generous. Would definitly stay there again. If I had to be fussy, the only downside was that cleaning staff came anytime between 09:00 and 16:00, so leave sign on your door if your in room during this time. But I dont want to end on a negative point, this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Frjcarney
Reviews.Content: Nice new property, pretty good location, convenient for metro and buses. Small room and no bath tub. Excellent breakfast - enough food and selection to last the day (but apparently, Germans like their bacon rare). friendly staff. Great price. Ask for a room away from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service; great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located in the western part of Berlin. You can take the #109 bus from Tegel airport, get off at Uhlandstrasse, cross the street and then just a short walk to the hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and professional. WiFi is free - just make sure you get the ID and password from the front desk. I had the most comfortable bed in the world. Most mornings I did not want to get out of bed. The bed linens are very nice and the duvet is washed after every guest. Housekeeping was excellent - it had to be the cleanest bathroom in the world. The rooms are modern and sleek. The only place to put your clothes are in the closest. Not a problem - I had plenty of room. It was nice to see an iron and an ironing board in the closet. My room faced the courtyard and it was extremely quiet. There was an electric kettle in the room with a selection of teas and instant coffee. Breakfast was outstanding - bacon, eggs, sausage, pancakes, yogurt, breads, cheeses, fresh fruit, cereal, juice and a selection of coffees and teas. The staff did an excellent job to make sure everything was replenished. One thing I did like about the hotel was the mature clientele. No running school children to disturb the peace and quiet. Pretty much a business crowd during the week with more tourists on the weekend. This hotel is much more upscale than the Hamptons is the US - it was more like a Hilton hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was all good”
Reviews.Author: Doc-US-08
Reviews.Content: Not one complaint. The location is convenient (and would have been even better if not for work on the metro). The staff were super friendly and helpful, and speak English very well. The room was clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was better than expected, and popular with everyone. You can't go wrong with this one. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MishaPrague
Reviews.Content: This is apparently the first Hampton Inn in Germany and I hope that more will appear in the near future.I like staying in Hampton Inns when I'm travelling in the USA.The Hampton Inn Berlin City West is in a very desirable location close to the Zoo and Savingny Platz train stations in the Charlottenberg district.The staff were very friendly and attentive.When I checked in I was given some tourist brochures, a map of the city and a local transport map.I got a phone call later in the day from the reception staff asking if I liked my room or had any requests.They have a few computers available in the lobby area for people who don't have their own computers.The room was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet provided offered a large selection of hot and cold food and various beverages.There is a variety of restaurants and large and small shops within a short distance of the hotel.I'd gladly stay there again the next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Close to centre”
Reviews.Author: davyb1944
Reviews.Content: Good value, good service, good room, good breakfast. This is - obviously - part of Hilton chain and is excellent value in city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and price!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyLibrarian
Reviews.Content: Four of us went to Berlin for the Christmas markets over thanksgiving. The Hampton's location could not have been better, service was very good and the pillows Devine!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KatarinaAdventures
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean, new and well kept. The room was a fair size for 2 people, the beds were comfortable. We had a room with the train at ear level and were very pleased that it was not at all disruptive; the sound blocking was excellent. The complimentary breakfast was very good and much appreciated when travelling to a new place on a first day where you don't know where to go yet. The location was very convienient, walkable to many attractions and a couple of blocks to the U-bahn subway station.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Detlev_73
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Hampton Inn on Uhlandstraße, and love it. The staff are very attentive and very customer-service oriented. The location is very nice: only one block north of the Uhlandstraße (U1) U-Bahn station, and 3 blocks from Zoologischer Garten (U2). The room is very modern yet cozy, and it's immaculate. The bathroom is pristine: I would hire someone to copy it for my home. For those that are traveling on business there are plenty of electrical outlets to plug in electronics, and the desk is perfect for setting up a laptop. The breakfast is very good, and has excellent selection; however, plan on having breakfast at an appropriate hour, as this is a popular hotel and there is frequently little space with all guests. Although there are several train-tracks right next to the hotel, the windows are perfectly noise-isolated. I will definitely stay here again. Hampton Inn does a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Netosf
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights in this wonderful hotel. From the moment we checked in, the staff did everything possible to make us feel welcome. The rooms, while small to US standards were modern, clean and nicely furnished. The breakfast each morning was more than ample to get us off to a great start. The location was very convenient to most of the sites in Berlin. The Ubahn and Sbahn (underground and elevated metro) was within walking distance, the free internet connection was excellent. Definately would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaurilioRoma
Reviews.Content: If you're going to berlin consider stay at Hampton by Hilton Berlin City West. I found a very comfortable accomodation with breakfast included that's very rare to find in US and Italy, the price was very competitive and the service was very excellent having the personnel a very gentle attitude for the guests. The internal room face the intrenal courtyard, but you have to consider you are staying in very Central City location: Kurfürstendamm!

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience”
Reviews.Author: trvler_11
Reviews.Content: This visit reaffirmed my high opinion of the Hilton chain, which provided excellent quality for a very reasonable price. The room was spotless, with modern furnishings and extremely comfortable bed. Having often had difficulty with European pillows either being too soft (feather) or hard foam, being able to sleep deeply was a blessing. The soundproofing was incredible and the darkening was effective...my early rising son slept three hours past sunrise. The location was ideal for both subway (U-Bahn and S-Bahn) and for walking. Unlike some areas, I had no fear about walking in this area with my family well after dark. The amenities were also miles ahead of the competition - parking was reasonable, free breakfast filled up my kids' bellies for hours, and the wifi was fast and free. All in all, this was a great experience (and I am normally a grumpy rater.)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: PatrolNH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a modern hotel about a 10 min. walk from the Zoo station. Nice size room, beautiful bathroom & towels, desk, free Wi-Fi, & free breakfast. On our last night there, my husband took ill and I had to go to the front desk to ask for an ambulance. They were very helpful and the ambulance was there in 5 min. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. The only drawback was there was no refrigerator and/or microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Tino_Nico
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite simply amazingly run. We had arrived 4 hours before check-in on the same day as the Berlin Marathon yet they were still able to provide us with a room... and a good one at that. The hotel is in a fabulous location just off the Ku'Damm, in very short walks to the Zoologische Garten and local u-bahn stations as well as the city circle tour buses all start from here. The hotel itself was very pleasing, starting with the breakfast which was quite easily the best hotel breakfast I've had while staying away with a great choice of cold and hot food, and plentiful at that. The staff are also very charming, helpful and quite eager to please, which they do. The room was visually stunning and even though we were facing the railway tracks, we heard absolutely nothing even when 4 trains went by. I cannot stress how much I enjoyed my stay here and when I go back to Berlin I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loxias27
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased Hampton Inns are opening up more in Europe. I travel to Berlin a lot for work, and have been waiting for a reasonably priced, good hotel to open (often they are so expensive). I saw this one had opened and used my HHonors points for a free stay to check it out. I arrived in Berlin at Tegel, caught the airport bus and got off at the main station, and then it was an easy 5 minute walk. The hotel is located just off the main shopping street of Kurfurstendamm and practically next to the Uhlandstrasse metro stop - which means you are right on the doorstep of lots of shops and restaurants, and the link to the rest of Berlin. To be fair, it's not a long walk to anywhere in Berlin centre - and it is a nice city for walking. I arrived early in the morning and my room was not available, but they were happy to securely lock my luggage away and let me use the facilities. I then went out for the day and by the time I returned my room was ready. The room was spacious, modern and well decorated. Good storage space and the bed was SO comfortable. The bathroom was modern and filled with quality toiletries. I actually had the best night's sleep ever in this hotel - amazing considering I had a nerve-racking interview the following morning. The breakfast was substantial, European fayre. There was the usual cereals, fruits, cold meats and dairy items. The seating area was huge, although completely full when I was there - I found myself a sofa in front of the TV to eat, so that was okay. Checkout was friendly and I will most definitely make this my hotel of choice when in Berlin now.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: 133Kay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless, modern, conveniently located with public transportation very nearby. Great selection of restaurants in the "hood". The staff were superb. It was like having a 24/7 private concierge service. The staff anticipated the unasked question. Gordon, in particular was outstanding. I am eager to return to Berlin and this hotel. Kay/Katie DC and TX

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Achilles C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is based on the West side of Berlin, which is the quiet area (East side is the busiest). Pros: It's close to the zoo and main streets with shopping abilities. Very nice WC, generally very clean room and good room and maid service. Quite friendly staff Acceptable decoration Cons: It's next to the train rails, so you can listen to the train every time it passes. It's not horrible noise since it's got good sound proof windows, but you can still hear some noise. Small beds (but I'm too tall, 6ft9, tall people avoid this!) The toilet door is a blurred glass door and it's no sound proof at all, you mind want to bear this in mind. Depends how confortable you are with your other half. Unconfortable pillows. They have very big and very soft pillows which are not the best ones. The matress is good though. The buffet is very poor. They use plastic orange coloured trays (it reminded me of university's canteen) and very poor selection of delicacies: omelete, saussages, some really bad tasting pankaces, bread and butter, coffee and orange juice. I could expect something more from a Hilton branded hotel. All in all, I would expect something more, and if it wasn't for the bed and pillows I wouldn't mind about the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanDT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what I would expect from a Hampton by Hilton. I stayed twice. The first time I had what I thought was a very nice room. The second time I had a similarly furnished room, but it was quite a lot smaller. Both were on the 7th floor. Both rooms were clean and quiet, both facing onto an internal courtyard area. There was a railway line running very close to the other side of the hotel. I imagine rooms on that side of the hotel would suffer from some noise. The food at breakfast was OK. Breakfast was very busy every day. Meeting rooms were opened to provide additional seating to the restaurant area. Getting a table somewhere wasn't a problem, but getting crockery, etc. and food was. The staff were struggling to replenish things quickly enough. Every day, something had run out when I arrived for breakfast and I had to wait a few minutes before it was replaced. Overall, I was satisfied with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room & shower”
Reviews.Author: miss_muriel
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned about the noise as our room was over the train tracks, however, you could barely hear the trains at all. The room was very comfortable & the shower appeared to be brand new, the water pressure was great & just what we needed after walking all day :-) The breakfast was great and the free internet a real perk!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great central location”
Reviews.Author: mtnlife2
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with modern furnishings, free wifi and full complimentary breakfast buffet (with eggs, bacon, sausage, the works). Great location is near the zoo station, savigny square, and is between the Kantstrasse and the famous Kurfurstemdammstrasse.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: jazzboots
Reviews.Content: Great position near Zoo Bahnhof transport hub,the shops of Kudamm and with numerous places to eat nearby. Clean ,comfortable and up to date rooms. Complimentary buffet breakfast above average. Staff helpful and friendly. The hotel is also easily accessable from the airport by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay here-it's a no brainer”
Reviews.Author: R0bdub
Reviews.Content: Current guest, Hilton Diamond member, staying at hotels over 100 nights per year this great hotel is up there with the best of them, forget Hampton brand in USA, this is up there with any Hilton in the world. You don't get the fancy overheads like doormen dressed in silly, out of date costumes. You just get great facilities, the staff are friendly, always a smile, nothing an issue. The breakfast is as good as any 5 star, the rooms are spacious and contemporary, the bathrooms are of a size where I could swing my cat, easily and they provide face-washers. Yes, right, in Europe, a hotel that has face washers. You even get a real double bed when you book one ( not the normal 2 single beds joined together ). The locality is right next to the main shopping boulevard in Berlin and there is an abundance of outstanding restaurants all within walking distance. Best of all, you only pay 3.5 to 4 star rates. If I had to pick one fault, the wireless internet is painfully slow. I reinforce PAINFULLY SLOW. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone whether be business or pleasure. Well done the the management and team at this great Hampton branded hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: simivalley1699
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Zoo station, trains, s-Bahn, and buses. The staff was extremely helpful, professional, and yet personal. We had a very quiet room; a/c worked well; rooms were efficient, closet for hanging clothes - no drawers; good lighting. Bathroom small - great shower. Safe deposit box at reception desk. Could not find any recycle bins anywhere. Breakfast was good; selections of warm and cold foods; juice, tea and coffee. Computers available in the lounge by the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Tedlooney
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hampton Berlin. The hotel is modern, very clean and it's in a great location close to the Ku’damm and only a few blocks away from Zoo station. We were able to explore the rest of Berlin from here using a 72 hour transport pass and there is an airport express train to/from Shönenfeld airport which stops at Zoo station. The hotel staff were polite and very helpful during our stay. Our room was spacious, comfortable and had aircon. The bed had the most comfortable pillows ever. Also in the room was an LCD TV, an easy chair and an office type chair. There was no safe in the room but there are safety deposit boxes in reception which are free and they give you the key to the box. The bathroom had a large shower but no bath. The only storage area for clothes was a small closet near the bathroom, there were no drawers or cupboards in the room but this wasn’t an issue for us as we were only there for the weekend. Our room was at the end of a corridor on the 5th floor and even though we were facing the railway there was hardly any noise. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and I had no problems connecting near reception but the signal in the room was a bit unstable at times. There are also 3 PCs and a printer near the bar with free internet access. The inclusive breakfast was very good. There was the usual continental style cold meats and cheeses, plus cereals yoghurt etc. There was also hot food including sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs and pancakes. I would recommend staying at the Hampton, it’s a great hotel and for the price we paid I think we got a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “the extra mile in service”
Reviews.Author: jjk94
Reviews.Content: The hotel belongs to the top of the hampton inn range with a high standard, clean spacious rooms, extensive beakfast (although waffles). Close to attractive shopping and good public transport nearby. Even bicycle ent s possible What makes is worth an extra star is the excellent and friendly service offered by the staff. Exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We have a divided opinion about this hotel in our family. On the positive side, this hotel is a new hotel with new bathrooms and other amenities. The service at the hotel is generally excellent and the hotel is exceptionally clean. The hotel has free Internet and breakfast. We had no problems with the Internet. On the negative side, our room was incredibly small. We had a room on the seventh floor with a balcony. It is the smallest room in which we have ever stayed outside of New York City and one hotel in Paris. Although many reviews note the low cost of the Hampton Berlin, our room was actually not that inexpensive, particularly given its size even as compared with other hotels where we have stayed in Berlin and elsewhere in Europe. In addition to being small, our room design was not very functional. Our room had no drawers, no hooks (aside from two hooks in the shower), and only one shelf at the top of the closet area. This meant that we had few options other than hangers for storage of clothing. We stayed at the Hampton Berlin for over one week and found the lack of drawers, hooks and shelves, combined with the small room size, to be a problem. The shower has a half glass enclosure, which meant that the bathroom floor got wet during showers. We also found the water temperature in the shower to be highly variable and had to stay on guard during showers and be prepared to leap out of the way when the water temperature suddenly increased without warning (this happened during most if not all showers that we took). The toilet in our room was also vey high. Breakfast at the Hampton was generally good and included cold meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, and juices/coffee. Hot options included pancakes, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage, and bacon. Although my traveling companion enjoyed breakfast, I thought the scrambled eggs tasted like cardboard. However, the breakfast was not bad for a free breakfast. The Hampton Berlin is in an excellent location. It is within a 5 minute walk of the Zoo train station and the Savignyplatz S-bahn station, and near multiple bus and U-bahn transit options. It is also close to major shopping areas and restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at in Europe”
Reviews.Author: JohnJurik1
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend staying at the Hampton Inn. A definite gem - it is clean and new, good location, quiet, inexpensive, very large rooms, lots of amenities, and the staff is very professional. It is 3 blocks walking to the Zoo train station, one of the major stations in Berlin. From this station we were able to get an inexpensive and convenient bus to Tegel airport as well as catch a Berlin walking tour. Excellent free breakfast - American and German style. Free newspapers and wifi in the room. Good sized flat screen TV with several English speaking stations. Good bar downstairs. One thing we really liked was the list of recommended restaurants they provided at the front desk. We ate at 3 of these restaurants - all were excellent and not too pricy. The surrounding neighborhood has lots of interesting shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good room standard, high value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eaton70
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in a single room on the first floor, with a window straight at the railway. Never heard a single noise from the trains! The rooms were really stylish, comfortable beds and a fresh bathroom Cons: The Breakfast buffet was kind of boring The hotel bar was really boring Pros: Location Value for money Friendly staff Fresh and clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: britfromtexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business event one block away in the Kempinski hotel. This was a great place to stay, very nice room with all the ameneties including free internet and iron in the room. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet. It is also on a route for multiple bus tours of the city if you have a few extra hours to take one of those. Not something I usually get to do traveling on business. I was sorry to read that Tegel airport is closing soon as this is an easy and short ride from that airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality for Good Price”
Reviews.Author: forsl
Reviews.Content: This new hotel offers a clean, modern room with an excellent breakfast buffet for a reasonable price. It's located within easy walking distance of public transportation, and is a short taxi ride from Tegel Airport (although this airport is due to be closed next year). There are loads of restaurants nearby to fit all budgets, and the staff, all of whom speak English, are welcoming, professional, and helpful. My only complaints are that there are no luggage racks and drawers to unpack things in. Excellent free WiFi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Skuuga13 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in marathon weekend and hotel was fully of runners. We came to hotel already 8 am, but we got a room so early (I don't know, was it because of Hilton Hhonors silvercard). Room was really nice. Breakfast was good also and on marathon sunday they started to serve it earlier than usually. In the lobby were 3 computers and a printer to complimentary, which was very nice. Many people do their check-inns to their flights here. Hotel situated nearby Kumfurstendamm, which is main roads in west Berlin. It was three blocks to Hard Rock Cafe or Zoologicher Garten railway station. Nearest underground station was Uhlandstrasse a block from hotel. Bus 109 comes straight from Tegel Airport to Uhlandstrasse U-bahn station every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: traveller201088
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, one of the best on our trip yet! Easy check in, great room. Just opened last year, purpose built. Right over the train tracks but you can barely hear them with the window shut (I had to listen for all except the oldest trains that went by), and with the airconditioning, why sleep with it open. Free wifi, and AMAZING breakfast, it made me sorry to leave! Its not in the centre of Berlin but very well connected, 100 or 200 bus lines (very good for tourists) and both S-Bahn and U-Bahn stop at Zoo Garten about 10 mins walk away. Hotel is a block of the Ku'damm. Staff were all friendly and efficient. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone, and would be very happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotell”
Reviews.Author: Staale L
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, so clean you can eat from the floor. Very good restaurant with a private garden so you can have your meals outside. Short walk to train station. Railway going past very close but so well sound proofed couldn't hear anything. Will come here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Tannpirker
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in room 310 for three nights, from Thursday to Sunday. We payed €260. I can't come up with anything to complain about :-) Hotel: Nice Room/bathroom: Delicate. Breafast: Excellent. Wireless internet: Yes Internet PCs with printer (free): Yes. Helpful staff: Yes. The train ran right outside the window, but we only heard a "distant buzz". (Good sound isolation I guess!) It's a 6-7 minute walk from the hotel to Zoologischer garten S-bahn/U-bahn. There's also two other U-bahn-stations within the same range.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Swainy78
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel last week. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. We arrived too early to check-in to our room (our fault, not the hotel's!) but the manager let me fill out the forms there and then, and we left our bags with them and got started on the sightseeing. The location is great. On the West side, it's within a ten minute walk of station at the zoo, from where you can get to pretty much anywhere in Berlin. The room was clean and modern, with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The only very minor gripe was a lack of drawers/storage space in the room, and slightly more seriously the lack of a safe in the bedroom. The hotel is right next to the train line. As we were on the 5th floor, the noise was minimal and it didn't disturb us in the slightest. I don't know if the same could have been said if we were on the 1st or 2nd floor, all I can say is that it didn't affect us one bit. The breakfast was buffet-style. There was a good selection, including bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages, bread rolls, cereals, muesli, etc... All in all this was a very well-priced and well-appointed hotel, in a great location, with very pleasant and helpful staff. I'd certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: saintbernard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. Read the reviews about train tracks but we stayed on 5th floor overlooking tracks. Windows are double panes and even though trains were running never had any noise problems. Hotel is walking distance (5min and well worth a visit) to Zoo and 1 minute to underground. Breakfast is extensive and has hot entrees. WiFi is fast and free. We left the Berlin Hilton to stay here and much better value with no downside. Staff is very accommodating with any need.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: dondeb_essex
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay here. The location is excellent - situated in a quiet side street off the Ku'damm less than 10 minutes walk to the Zoo Station. Tne quickest way to walk to the hotel is via Kantstrasse. The check in was friendly and efficient. We were asked whether we required wi-fi access in our room. There are also 3 computers in reception with free internet access. This was really useful for finding good local restaurants and checking opening times of museums, etc. The rooms are clean and modern with excellent sparkling bathrooms. Breakfast is complimentary and a real bonus. Safety deposit boxes are available free of charge at Reception. If you have a late flight it's worth asking whether you can keep your room until later in the day. The hotel were full but they still agreed we could keep it until 2pm at no additional cost, which was very useful. These are our recommendations:- If arriving at Schonefeld airport, buy an ABC ticket for just 3 euros. This takes you to the Zoo Station in about 30 minutes. Remember to validate your ticket before travel!! For sightseeing, buy a 3 or 5 day AB or ABC Welcome card. These can be purchased at the Hotel and can also be used to obtain discounts at attractions and restaurants. The Reisebank at the Zoo Station is perfect for currency exchange (including travellers cheques) as it is open until 9pm. If you have an interest in Modern History, Berlin is a fantastic place to visit. There is just so much to see and do. We're hoping to return next year. A great hotel choice in a friendly and fascinating city. We absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great rooms, fantastic meetings”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: The Hampton by Hilton hotel really delighted me by the way I was first met at the property and that they remembered my name during the 3 days I was there for a business meeting. The freshness of the total property (lobby, 24 hour fitness and guest room/bed) were superb. Better yet this hotel did a wonderful job with a small meeting (20 people and film crew) for us. The lunch meals they arranged were hot, tasty and varied since it was a global team coming together.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to berlin”
Reviews.Author: kbfitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful home for a first family vacation to berlin. the rooms and staff were exellent. great location, quiet rooms---inspite of trams. super staff. can't wait to visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to express a good or bad review. so read my points below”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerCyprus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near kufurnstendam street which is the main High Street of Berlin. KeDeWe a nice department store is very close. The Zoological garder is very close as well. The room was new and clean. Although it is just outside the railway of the train the windows are sound proof so there is little noise. There is no restaurant. The breakfast is ok. The hotel staff are mostly very kind and smiling but always helpfull. I had a very bad experience with the internet. When you open your PC there is only one WiFi network whereas you have to pay to receive internet. The hotel though gives you free password but there was nowhere writing either in the room or the WiFi website Free Pass from the reception. I learned this by accident from another guest and the hotel did not refund me because they are saying there are signs in the room and i had to see them. I did not see such a sign. Overall it is a good value for money if you are not asking for luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for berlin weekend”
Reviews.Author: IanT55
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this newish hotel not far from the trendy savignyplatz and the kudamm. loved my stay. Room is modern and clean. nice and quiet despite proximity of trains. Bonuses-free wifi in the room, a PC downstairs, free breakfast-ample buffet style, great little gym. People were very friendly on reception-young and enthusiastic. I would come back definitely as good value. Like others i was baffled by the lack of staorage space-there are not even any coat hooks-i had to hang up my suit in the shower!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityTraveller86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner in february. Overall the hotel was ok, it provided a nice continental breakfast and the room was very clean and spacious. Upon arrival the member of staff tried to check us into a room which was already occupied. This was sorted out after the second time of visiting the desk . The location is ok, if you don`t mind getting a train into other parts of Berlin. I highly recommend going on the fat bike tour of Berlin. Its great if you only have a few days in the city and want to visit all the sites within a day! The staff are really informative too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value and well run; be aware of the train”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: I don't give a lot of "fives" but this Hampton offered excellent value in a fabulous location in the former West, and everything they did was done very well. It is not a five star resort, of course; it's a business traveler and tourist-oriented Hampton, where we found everything as it should be and the employees all on top of their game. I get the impression that the European Hamptons by Hilton are a half-step above most of the US Hamptons (and we know in the US that a recently-constructed, purpose-built Hampton is almost always nicer than a retrofit). The hotel is new, immaculate, and very comfortable -- a quality facility. It fits within the Hampton format, not opulent, but probably physically nicer and of higher quality than most American Hamptons. We were there for four nights and the staff was friendly and efficient, even greeting us by name where they could, when we walked past the desk. The breakfast buffet was extensive and well done, with a far greater selection of hot items than one would expect at a Hampton in the US. They had pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, and a wide selection of cold items. The neighborhood immediately to the south of the hotel is very charming, largely residential with lots of local shops (some cool lamps and home decor) and neighborhoody restaurants, pharmacies, ATMs. It includes Ku'Damm, West Berlin's historic broad shopping boulevard, which is sort of like their Fifth Avenue (if you're from NY). But the rest of the neighborhood reminded me more of NY's Upper East Side, in terms of the character of the shops and restaurants. Ku'Damm is now rivaled by the resurgence of shopping on Unter Den Linden in the former East, but it's still a very nice place to walk, shop or eat, day or evening. The Uhlandstrasse U-Bahn stop is about one block south of the hotel. Continuing south on Uhlandstrasse about four blocks more, there is a new, immaculate laundromat, handy for a family on a long stay. Sevignyplatz and all its restaurants are one block west, just down an alley. The Bahnhof Zoo transit station is a major station that gets you right out to anywhere else in Berlin, and it is an easy 10 minute walk north of the hotel. The Zoo itself is also right there. BZ is a more gritty neighborhood, but that's Berlin, and at no time did we feel unsafe. The Hampton is also on the side of town closest to the airport, making it a relatively quick and affordable taxi ride. One caveat -- there is an elevated train that runs behind the hotel. I did not hear the train whatsoever. But if you are sensitive to train noise, you might want to ask about that, in terms of the location of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Place”
Reviews.Author: livingthedreem
Reviews.Content: Very warm welcome by staff, checked in quickly and was given map to show attractions. We had a room on the 7th floor, we cheked in with family and was given rooms 704 and 705.
