Our first reaction was great, as we requested to be together. Do not be fooled by this, as the room numbers are eratic to say the least! Our room was opposite the lift and overlooking the trains, the other room was along the corridoor and round the corner. We asked to move to be together, but was told that it was not possible, however nobody else seemed to be on that floor. The rooms are typical Hampton standard, offering everything that you need for a city stay. Everything was perfectly clean with a queen bed, the bathroom was of good quality. The shock when opening the door to the outside though, took away that first good impression. The patio was extremely large with no furnature to sit out there, then came the noise trains in both directions! The Hampton Inn is a great place to stay for a city break, make sure that you requst a room away from the railway if you are not into trains, also that you have a high room. Could not fault the staff and how clean the hotel was throughout.

Reviews.Title: “one of the very best Hampton properties, superb location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JKII
Reviews.Content: Amazingly charming and helpful multilingual staff, terrific breakfast buffet with hardboiled and scrambled eggs, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, three kinds of cold meats (ham, salami, liverwurst), two cheeses, plus bacon ,sausage, bread and rolls, very comfortable room only lacking drawer or place for suitcase (I balanced mine on top of small bedside table), good lighting, very good bathroom, outstanding value. Location surrounded by several good restos, easy walk (I hate to walk) to subway with only two stops to KaDaWe (largest dept store in Europe with incredible food hall on 6 and resto on 7th floor--think champagne and oysters, bouillabaisse, German specialties, French pastry OMG it was dazzling). I highly recommend this hotel (and I have stayed over 150 nights recently in Hamptons).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it so much,going back in Dec !”
Reviews.Author: clive165
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hampton by Hilton and would recommend this hotel to every one.The hotel is situated in West Berlin,just 2 minutes from the lovely avenue of Kurfurstendamm,which has numerous shops,restaurants and bars.There are also 2 stations very close by.Though East Berlin is a little distance,the u and s bahns are so good that you are never far from any of the main attractions. The Hotel is very clean,with the rooms being spotless and very comfortable,although storage for clothes is a little limited.Thats a thing ive noticed with hotels in Germany,the fixtures and furnishings are so modern and pleasing on the eye but this is not always practical when you are on a 2 week vacation with big,big suit cases ! Unfortunately there is not an in room safe(something i always look out for) but there are safe deposit boxes down at reception,so this was not to much of a problem. Also tea and coffee making facilities in the room,always a big bonus ! We paid around £80 a night ,which included breakfast.Breakfast was ample and i particularly enjoyed the fruit and yogurts,followed by Bacon and Sausages.There are also many cereals,eggs and pancakes.It does get very hectic down there between 8 and 9 am but we always managed to get a table. The staff are all very nice and helpfull,esp the manager who every time he saw us asked if everything was ok. The only problem we had was on our final night. After spending the day out we came back to our room for a quick freshen up around 5.00pm Unfortunately our room had not been cleaned,but believe it or not with in 5 minutes of coming back there was a knock on the door from the chamber maid who asked if she could service our room. We asked if she could come back after wed gone back out,to which she agreed,but when we got back late at night the room still had not been cleaned.When we checked out the following morning and mentioned this at reception,they gave us that night for free as its their policy to give you a clean and comfortable room each might. We are coming back to Berlin in Dec and have absolutely no hesitation in staying herea gain or recommending it to anybody else. Berlin Rocks !!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: silkycoco
Reviews.Content: It took about 15 minutes to walk from the X9 bus stop to the hotel. There are many highend clothing stores in the area. The hotel is small but clean. Our room was on the second floor and right next to the above ground train, but we were not bothered by any noise. There is no lock on the glass door to the bathroom if anyone is concerned about privacy issues.

Reviews.Title: “It just keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: kwebb100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just after it opened and knew immediately I was staying at a "diamond in the rough". It was brand new and had a few problems related to just opening. On my second stay I wrote a review and gave this hotel a 5-star rating. They had fixed the "newness" problems and had so many good points that I gave them a top rating. It probably seems strange giving a hotel that is not "full service" a 5-star rating but they do so many things right that it justified it. I have stayed at 3 other good Berlin hotels before returning again to the Hampton. After another multi-night stay I have to say they just continue to keep improving. The rates are low, the rooms are large, modern and spotlessly clean. The beds are perfect. The breakfast and internet are both good and free. They have in-room coffee/tea. Their people make you feel like you have come home rather than to a hotel. This hotel is simply the best value in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: zorro421
Reviews.Content: The Hampton by Hilton hotel was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. I arrived early in the morning and was given a room at 0930 the room was very clean and new. the staff was very helpful. I will stay here on all my future visits to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: chris_moffatt
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights the rooms were very clean and contempory looking. they are slightly smaller then what you see in any pictures of the room on the internet however they did not dissapoint. had to live out of a suitcase as there are no drawers for clothes. hangers can be found in the side wardrobe for shirts etc. the bed was very comfortable and pillows that swallow you up like a big marshmellow. free internet is a big bonus when planning your trips. breakfast is free from 6am-10am and they provide a wide spread of hot and cold food. there really is something for everyone. had something different every day. the location is amongst a large restaurant area which is fantastic after a long day in berlin. from the hotel take a short walk to a multitude of restaurants. very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “super in all respects”
Reviews.Author: 1reisefan
Reviews.Content: We are from Louisiana, stayed 5 days and were impressed by the helpful and knowledgeable staff; our comfortable room overlooked the courtyard and was quiet; the hotel was spotless and its location is perfect. also great location, very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff make this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: JofromFrance
Reviews.Content: This feels like a hotel for business people though in August it was full of tourists. The decor is smart and sober but lacks character. Access from both Tegel and Schönefeld airports is straightforward (bus 109 from Tegel to Uhlandstrasse, about 20 mins, "Regio" train from Schönefeld to Zoologischer Garten, about half an hour). Our room was not very big and there was little storage space for clothes, only a small cupboard with one high shelf. Nowhere to put suitcases except on the floor of the cupboard and that was only big enough for one medium-sized case. There was other shelving and a desk and chair in the room as well as bedside tables so plenty of room for books, maps, cameras etc, also good lighting. A lovely and spacious shower room. All in very good order and kept spotlessly clean. Following advice from this site we asked for a room that did not overlook the railway line and found it perfectly quiet both day and night. We looked out over a large inner courtyard and the room was bright. The hotel is quite well situated for getting around Berlin with both buses and underground trains which will get you into the historic centre in about 20 mins. Potsdamer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate are closer. Also, in about half an hour you can get out of the city by bus or train, to lakes and forest, and there are some interesting museums to see here as well as in the centre. The buffet breakfast was fine though the scrambled eggs were like very tasty yellow sponge. But what made our stay really pleasant was the staff. There are always several people on duty at reception and they are welcoming and helpful. They recognise the guests even though the hotel is big and there must be a lot of people to remember, and take time to advise them on travel, sights, shops etc and sort out problems. The staff at breakfast too are polite and quick to help and always friendly. This really makes a difference in what otherwise could be a very impersonal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic dervice”
Reviews.Author: ZOIOslo
Reviews.Content: I've seldom experienced such serviceminded frontdesk or breakfast-waiters. Besides it's centrally located!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: ryecatcher19
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a great rate for this hotel and it was such a bargain. A great location near to the Zoo S-bahn station & U- bahn. We arrived near to 1am at the nearest station and hopped into a taxi - it's wasily walkable to the hotel but it's handy to know there are cabs available if you arrive late and don't know quite where you're going. The hotel is modern, clean and well appointed. No minibar as mentioned but they're usually a rip-off so I didn't mind. Our room was a little noisy due to our proximity to the train line but we soon got used to the rather soothing sound of the trains. I'd bring ear plugs or be prepared to kick up a fuss at reception if you get stuck with a noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: shabbytiger52
Reviews.Content: This was the third time weve been to Berlin and always stay around the Kuferstendamm area in 3-4* hotels. By far this was the nicest hotel, great room, very comfortable and clean. Great seats in the room to relax in after sightseeing & good choice of tea & coffee, however there's no fridge/ mini bar should you need to cool down drinks. Although there is no variation with the breakfasts daily, they are good with an adequate selection and a choice of coffee's which was a nice touch. Staff all friendly and pleasant, except for the duty manager who was efficient but zero personality. Requested a quiet room and this was not a problem. The hotel is in a great location with a good choice of restaurant's etc a few minutes walk in either direction and only a short walk to the main Zoo S-bahn station. U- bahn station at end of street. After staying here, we wouldnt bother looking for any other hotels in Berlin and are already planning our next trip for the spring

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place, has it all”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awesome. The rooms were fantastic quality and very clean. The breakfasts had everything you wanted and the staff were really helpful. The location was superb, short walk to numerous train stations to get around Berlin and the tree lined streets of the Kurfürstendamm district were beautiful. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 2002ad
Reviews.Content: I requested a month in advance for a room away from the train tracks but this was not met, which was disappointing. However that aside, it was a great value hotel close to both U & S bahn stations. Happy to report that they open up the conference rooms for breakfast when it is busy so had no problems finding a table even when it was busy. You won't find a better value hotel in Berlin, and despite the small train noise I would consider staying here if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: RoadCalls
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just close to the metro and very easy access from Tegel airport by bus. The room was big and nicely decorated, bathroom spotlessly clean and the shower was great, bed very comfortable. The stuff at the reception was very friendly and helpfull and I felt very welcomed all the time during my stay. The breakfast was pretty good and a nice bonus as well. I'll definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone who would like to stay at a nice, clean, quiet and centrally located hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hillites
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin on an overnight train. We went to the hotel to see if we could drop off our luggage and check in later that afternoon. Naemi, the Guest Service Agent, booked us in and because they were not busy, assigned us a room straight away. To be able to unpack and freshen up in our room was wonderful. The room was spotlessly clean, very comfortable and the hotel is a short walk from the Savignplatz railway station. The questions we asked were handled graciously and professionally. The breakfast, included in the price was amazingly good. When you find staff of the calibre of this young lady, it is enough reason to bring us back again to such a comfortable, guest friendly, hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money and excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BagelmanSpleen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in May. The hotel is pretty new so there are some good deals to be had. Reception staff were friendly. Rooms were nice, clean and shower was good. Breakfast buffet had a good choice (loved the Bircher muesli). Location is excellnt, near public transport and within walking distance to a lot of places as well. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but adequate”
Reviews.Author: chrissy1803
Reviews.Content: Had all that was required, but nothing extra. Having recently stayed at Hilton and Best Western Hotels it was a bit of a come-down. Breakfast good, but not as many choices as other two hotel chains offered. Canteen-style surroundings - tables not set with cutlery etc and no table linen. Room very small and compact. No bath, but very good power shower. Sliding wardrobe door doubles up as bathroom door. Wardrobe is just a short rail with a small shelf for all your clothes. However, iron and ironing board are provided in wardrobe! Didn't bother unpacking suitcase as nowhere to put everything. Free wireless internet which had excellent connection. Air conditioniong very effective and quiet. Parking at hotel costs 12 euros per day, but we found a carpark a few hundred metres away which charged 3 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DorisSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: I normally don't like posting reviews but not with the Hampton Hotel in Berlin¨ Hotel: This hotel is great value for money. Most of the staffs are helpful : if you are lucky to be checked - in by Florian Nowotny, then you are assured of a sincere and welcoming smile. This young receptionist addresses most guests by their names. It does not happen seldom these days! Room: Our room was extremely clean! The bathrooms as well. The internet connection was fabulous. The hotels is close to a rail way but with doors closed and the aircondition , we practically had no noise on the 6th floor. Breakfast : Lots of varieties. Great to start the day with...and included in the room! Location : The location is great. Some few minutes walk to Savingy Platz where you can take the train which connects to all attractions. The famous Ku'damm strasse is just around the corner. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PDScotland
Reviews.Content: Great location, being very close to Ku'Damm, and transport (trains and U -Bahns) all close at hand. Rooms very well kitted out, and well insulated (barely hear the trains outside) - cleaned every day to impeccable standard. Breakfast buffet was good, with plenty choice, but hot items sometimes took a while to be replenished, and complimentary wi-fi was a welcome bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - a great base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: debzdevil
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel during a 5 night trip to Berlin. This hotel is a couple of minutes walk from Uhlandstrasse U-bahn station and is within 10 minutes walk of the much larger Zoologischer Garten U-bahn station. The staff were very friendly and welcoming in this hotel and happy to speak English. The decor throughout was very modern and the room and all public areas were clean and tidy. The room was spacious with a large TV and we could barely hear the S-bahn passing alongside the hotel. The free breakfast buffet provided something for everyone with a variety of hot and cold food options. There were 3 computers in the reception/bar area with free internet access and printing facilities. Although this hotel is not close to many of the sights of Berlin, the U-bahn, S-bahn and buses are very reliable and easy to use. I would recommend purchasing a Berlin WelcomeCard (you can get this from Tegel Airport on arrival at the Tourist Info desk) which allows free travel on all 3 transport systems in Berlin along with good discounts to many attractions. Overall this was a brilliant trip and I would not hesitate in choosing the Hampton by Hilton for my next stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Taner3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton for 4 nights (1 single and 1 double room). It is located at Berlin West. Location is very good. Short walking distance to Zoological Garden, S and U stations as well as shops on Ku'Damm. Breakfast is included and is quite nice. Two items we missed: No safe deposit box and no minibar in the rooms. Room service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Justbritishthatsall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for the first stop in out European tour, and it was a great start! The complimentary wi-fi and breakfast were big bonuses, because we had a very hungry teenager! Being really close to the Kurfürstendamm made the stay even better and it was four minutes walk to the nearest U-bahn. I really recommend the restaurants on Savignyplatz which is just through the passageway just out of the hotel. San Marino does beautiful Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back”
Reviews.Author: ryahalomi
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 5 nights, great location close to the Zoo stations , a walk sistance to the S Ban and U Ban. Breakfast is great , the front desk staff are very nice and helpfull they are available and they know some good restorants in the area. The room was O.K airconditioned, very quiet , it was in the back , the only thing missing is a cupboard to place clothes for more than 2 nights. We recommand the hotel and will come back next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: tholland55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very handy location for both shopping and tourism. The hotel is easy to get to by both taxi and other public transport. The staff were friendly and helpful as well as being very professional. Breakfast was included an had choices of both hot and cold foods. The rooms were quiet as long as the windows were shut properly and the rooms had all the modern conveniences. Wi-fi was free and you could purchase beer, soft drinks etc for a reasonable price from the front counter. Would recommend as a tourist class hotel with all the right attributes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jen158
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days sightseeing with family. It is new and morden hotel but next to rail road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mot29
Reviews.Content: A cut above US Hamptons. Large comfortable room, big bathroom (although no separate tub or shower). Breakfast is US Hampton and European "continental" combined. Lots of variety. The hotel is about a block from the Kufurstendam U-bahn station and the city bus to and from the airport is also a block away. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: After reading the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor, we were looking forward to this stay. I have to say our review is mixed, although more positive than negative. Highs: - Excellent location. Short walk (or taxi) from the Zoologischer Garten train station; the Zoo station has excellent bus service from Tegel airport via bus X9, an airport express bus. Although we didn’t feel unsafe, note that the Zoo station is very busy and there are some undesirable characters around so for getting around Berlin use the much nicer and closer-to-hotel Savignyplatz train station. The Berlin Hauptbahnhof (main train station) is a just a few train stops from either Zoo or Savignyplatz, with no transfers required. A short walk to Ku’damm (nice shopping and restaurants). Summary – by using public transport and walking short distances you do NOT need a taxi to get virtually anywhere in Berlin from this hotel. - Great included breakfast. - Fresh, new hotel. - Very friendly staff. Lows: - Small room with no good place to store luggage. - Included wifi did not work, despite much trying. We were told at checkin that they had just switched providers and wifi was unavailable for the first evening. Switching providers didn’t fix it, at least for us. Could not maintain a connection for more than a minute or so – this was very frustrating, especially since the signal strength always showed as excellent. - Booking our reservation was an absolute disaster. I booked online 5 months in advance, but noticed a significantly lower rate prior to our trip. I called their USA internet help line and asked for the lower rate and was told that it would be no problem to change the rate, but I had to make 4 more calls to this internet help line and never got the lower rate; they cancelled but didn’t rebook; then rebooked for the wrong month; I asked for a supervisor and was placed on permanent hold; I was frankly afraid that I would show up with no valid reservation so once I finally had a new confirmation # I stopped calling, even though I didn’t have the lower rate. Book online but do NOT call their “help” line. While in Berlin, consider purchasing a Berlin Welcome Card, available at Tegel and various other locations throughout (google Berlin Welcome Card for details). The Welcome Card includes unlimited public transport (trains and buses, including the X9 bus from Tegel) and some nice discounts on tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Andykn3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton by Hilton on a long weekend at the end of June 11 with my son. The hotel is modern and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious with very good facilities. As an earlier reviewer commented our room too overlooked the railway but due to the great sound proofing there was hardly any sound from it. The self service breakfast was more than ample with loads of choice of both food and drink. Although the hotel is a little out of the centre there are a number of U and S bahn stations nearby so no problem with getting about. The only issue we had with the underground was that at one of the stations, Gleisdreieck, en route to the city centre there was maintenance work being carried out and we found that the trains ended there which was a bit of a nuisance. I'm not sure how long the work is going to take so it may be worth bearing in mind if you are travelling there soon. I would definitely stay at the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Itsme46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'Hampton by Hilton' hotel in June 2011. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. The hotel is modern with very friendly and helpful staff. It is only a short walk to the U-bann and main bus routes. You can pick up a free map of the centre of Berlin at reception. Also at reception they have small cards that tell you all about the main tourist attractions. We stayed in a double bedroom which is spacious and very modern. There is air conditioning in room. You do not need to take toiletries with you as they provide soap, hand lotion, shampooo and conditioner. The complimentary breakfast with excellent. A varied mixture of food. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. If I ever go back to Berlin I would have no hesitation to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only about 2-3 blocks from the Spandau train station and 1 block from the underground. We were given a room on the 7th floor facing the railway. The room was very nice and clean. Even though the rail is next to the hotel you dont hear it with the window closed. Our room had a balcony but no furniture on the balcony to use so we never spent anytime on the balcony. Breakfast is served everyday and was included in our price.The same thing is served everyday but you have many choices and everything tastes fresh. There was plenty of hot water and pressure was good. The bed was comfortable. The Air Condition was awesome as we were there on a few very hot days. The room did not have a safe in it. Things we visited while there. Concentration camp which is an hour away by train. Checkpoint charlie, Exotic museum, Museum Island and Dom. TV Tower, Brandenburg gate and Jewish memorial. There is a great Thai food place one block away. The Thai Elefant. Yummy food. This hotel is great and the people working there are very nice and very helpful.Every coworker gave great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: mm3003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, there are two bueses 100 and 200 which go to all major tourist attractions, it's a 7 min walk to train station also, the hotel is clean and comfortable with helpful staff, definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no place for luggage”
Reviews.Author: Eva9160
Reviews.Content: in general this is a good hotel. There were 2 things that were a bit of a problem. When we arrived (2 ladies and we stood for 5 days) we were looking for the closet to put our clothes away. Suprise: there isn't one. The manager found that closets are overrated and his first solution was to put us in another hotel! His second option was a family room so we could store our suitcases on th coach. Second problem: there are no safes in the rooms. I asked to put away my laptop at the reception but it didn't fit in their safe! Conclusion: good hotel if you don't have luggage of valuables with you

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in western part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: majtek
Reviews.Content: I spend wonderful two days in Hampton Berlin. It was one of only few descent hotels in Berlin which offer triple rooms. Room has big double bed and extra sofa. Everything is new and looks great. Only problem is parking, hotel is providing only a few parking places, and all where occupied when I arrived. Fortunately, just one block away is public parking, which cost 10 euro for 24h.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: FORB's
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hampton for four nights recently and the hotel, staff, and location could not be faulted. There was a bit of a mix up booking in, but it was sorted quickly, and the staff gave us a voucher for a free drink at the bar for the inconvenience. The room and bathroom were very nice, lots of room, but strangely there are no drawers to put smaller items into, everything goes into the wardrobe. The breakfast was really good, cooked or continental, and lots of it as well, just the thing to start your day. The location could not be faulted either, just off the Kurfurstendam, and a couple of minutes walk away from either Uhlandstrasse U Bahn or Savignyplatz S Bahn which gets you to where you want to get to easily. Savignyplatz has a great selection of restaurants too, we had German, Greek, and Tapas during our stay, and all reasonably priced as well. Overall we had a great time in Berlin, and I have no hesitation in recommending the Hampton by Hilton, and we will certainly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Travellers OR tourists!”
Reviews.Author: EJPVA
Reviews.Content: This is the first Hampton Inn in Germany, and opened in the Fall 2010, and stills appears to be brand-new. It is extremely convenient -- one block from the Ku-Damm (unbelievable shopping and restaurant district) in one direction and Thomas Square (restaurants, and more shopping) the other. On-site parking garage. Adjacent to the U-Bahn, so you may want to ask for a room on the other side, although most people said you couldn't hear it at night. Rooms are spotless; bathrooms have every convenience. Only thing to criticize was the only place for luggage was actually on the sofa. Free high speed internet for HHonors members worked great. Staff was awesome! Has a bar and provides an excellent hot breakfast. Great place for business travellers or tourists.

Reviews.Title: “I’m delighted with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarioXP
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel with everything what you need including also iron, café machine. The room is modern, very clean and spacey. Hotel is located 4 min walk from well know shopping street. Metro station is near, train station is 10 min walk away. Breakfast is OK (4 of 5). Train runs near the hotel but hotel is well sound protected. It has gym and free Internet. Staff is worm, friendly and very helpful. My opinion is that this is good value hotel. I haven’t stayed in any other hotel in Berlin and only because of that I can’t say this hotel is the best buy.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BurtRoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. It had everything you could ask for: great accommodations, extremely helpful and qualified staff. It was very clean. In short, it had everything. A great value. In fact, it was the best hotel I've stayed in in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: tiggerflute
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in Berlin enroute home from Europe. The rate we got for this hotel seemed too good to be true, but it turned out to be as pleasant as we hoped it would be. Hamptons are not fancy but we've often found them to be outstandingly priced in relation to their quality. Like others, this one was impeccably clean with a modern bathroom and wonderful beds. The hotel is situated right next to train tracks but don't let it deter you: quintuple-layered sound-insulated windows muffle the sound even in the rooms directly overlooking the track. The gentle white-noise hush of the excellent A/C fan serves as an additional noise-canceling feature, and the location of the hotel is in a much quieter place than others we considered. It is about two blocks away from the best shopping street in Berlin, the Kurfurstendamm. It is also situated on the border of one of the choicest neighborhoods in Berlin, Charlottenburg, which boasts streets lined with boutiques, cafes and beautiful buildings. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The gratis high-speed Wifi in the room was inconsistent, a problem we've had in numerous hotels, but there is a bank of computers in the lobby for guest use. There is a nice fitness room with a flat-screen TV, and breakfast is included. However, the breakfast more resembles the unexciting buffet typical of mid-level American hotels than the often sumptuous European spreads, so that was nothing to write home about. Only the bread stood out over its American counterparts. As long as you aren't looking for fancy, the Hampton by Hilton Berlin City West is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent. Very Pleased with our booking”
Reviews.Author: Triggsymate
Reviews.Content: I booked this place when something else fell through. 3 of us were sharing a triple (double and sofabed) and the rate worked out brilliantly. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. 1 euro to look after your bags as we had arrived so early was a little unusual but hardly an issue. Room was very comfortable, great bathroom and shower. Hotel was quiet and a/c meant you didn't need to open windows. Breakfast was great - mixture of fruits, toast and hot food. Internet WIFI was free and staff were helpful in giving you the codes. Location is 5min walk from Uhlandstrasse station, which makes commuting easy. Couldn't have asked for more from my booking, and the best part was we felt it was def value for money as well. I would highly recommend this place and thank the staff and hotel for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton in the Hilton chain, easy access to trains”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are at our 5th stop in Europe and this has been the best hotel so far even though this is the "lower end" of the Hilton chain. The hotel is kept in immaculate shape. Staff is very helpful. As others have commented, the train tracks are behind the hotel but it doesn't matter. We were on the 7th floor next to the tracks and you really can't hear the trains. There is a subtle dull rumble, but the place doesn't move and shake as other houses or hotels we have been in. If the TV is on, you don't even know there is a train outside. Unlike other Hamptons in the states, this one has a pretty complete breakfast. It is not just a simple travelers continental. The rooms are clean and everything looks new. They advertise that this is the first Hampton in Germany. The only thing they might want to add is furniture on the balcony. On the 7th floor we had a fairly large balcony but couldn't really sit and relax on it. The easiest train station to get off on is Savignyplatz. Just go to the street level and head towards the Zoo train stop. The hotel is in between those stops, next to the tracks off the main boulevard. There is a short cut through an alleyway from Savignyplatz restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, spotlessly clean rooms and great location all wrapped up in a fantastic value package.”
Reviews.Author: pdmonks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times now and the quality of service and rooms was consistently excellent. For this great price to have breakfast and full-hotel wifi included is a real bonus and makes it a great business and vacation choice. No noise from the adjacent train line but if you walk along it across the street you find some excellent restaurants. My real stars at this hotel go to the staff, in particular Florian and Erik on the front-desk. Nothing was too much trouble. One particular example, my colleague and I were working in the business lounge across the lobby from reception when my colleague sneezed. Within seconds a male receptionist was at his side with a paper tissue. Amazing!! Our rooms all had bed sofas so would work well for families. Shower and bathroom (no bath) also spotless and have wall-mounted shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/handwash etc. Also full marks for in-room tea and coffee making equipment, often not found in European hotels. It really has it all for a short break or business stop-over at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for Berlin City Break”
Reviews.Author: Coolonela
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because we got a great flight & stay deal with BA & normally the Hilton family are a pretty safe bet. This is a large business focussed hotel but OK for tourists. On the plus side it's easy to find, close to stations on the U-Bahn & S-Bahn. A taxi from Tegal airport is less than 20 Euros. Efficient check in & (Stephanie) was very helpful in providing us with local maps & details of the welcome card & open top bus tours etc (we bought both from the hotel). Rooms are spacious, well fitted & clean. Tea & Coffee making facilities, flat screen TV & desk. Really comfortable bed & powerful shower with shampoo, conditioner & shower gel provided (all helps if you're tight on your weight allowance). Free wireless internet access in room & throughout the hotel. The PCs in the lobby are also free if you don't bring your own machine. The hotel was full when we stayed but it never seemed crowded, lots of space. Breakfast was included & was self service. Quite as good choice & enough to get you started for the day. Some reviews I read talked about nearby building work but that is all finished now. Negative points: We asked for adjacent rooms with our friends but although we were assured this was the case on arrival, when we went to the rooms later in the day they were some way apart. The guy on reception wasn't interested in sorting this out as the hotel was full & managed a grudging apology. Worth saying he was the exception to an otherwise very helpful & friendly staff who spoke excellent English. The hotel doesn't do meals other than breakfast, so you have to eat out (no problem as there are loads of restaurants nearby). It is right on top of the railway line, so there is some noise from that even though it is efficiently double glazed. Probably not great for a very light sleeper but it didn't bother us, we slept well throughout our stay. There is no in room safe but safe deposit boxes are available at reception. There is no drawer space in the room, but not too much or an issue on a short break. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for a short city break in Berlin & would probably stay here again if we came back & could get the same deal with BA (bargain).

Reviews.Title: “Request away from S-bahn could not be granted but...”
Reviews.Author: K_S_Sjogren
Reviews.Content: I requested that I get a room away from the S-bahn but upon arrival my request could not be granted for unknown reason. The staff let me know that I would not be bothered by the noise and they were actually right. It was very quiet and a good night sleep was ensured. Although this was a standard room it was quite spacious and immaculately clean. The location is very good overall, very close to Ku'damm and Uhlandstrasse is a treat for people interested in interior design. Stilwerk, a large shopping center for exclusive homeware, is right up the street and there are plenty of small high-end stores along the street. Towards Kurfürstendamm, there's a Zwilling J.A. Henckels store for excellent cutlery from Solingen as well as a Villeroy & Boch store for fine China porcelain. If you are just remotely interested in good coffee then Berliner Rösterei is a must. Their Portugiesischer Espresso Dunkel is an absolutely stunning blend. In fact, the best I have ever had. The beans are roasted in the store and you need not worry about lack of freshness. They're never more than a few days past roasting date. The breakfast at the hotel is nothing special but fully adequate. The Staff is very professional and friendly but do not seem to engage in chit-chat. They want to keep control. Not that I mind. I stayed two nights and on the day after arrival the sheets were not changed. This might be an environmental decision on behalf of the hotel but not one that I was informed about. This is not a big deal. The bed is very good but most of the pillows are way too thick which means your head will stay in a very awkward tilted position. Again, a minor problem. Overall a priceworthy choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: APMH
Reviews.Content: Service was absolutely excellent, nothing was too much trouble and they made some very good suggestions for nearby restaurants. Rooms were spacious and clean - our rooms were on the railway side but we barely heard anything and had no trouble sleeping. Good selection for breakfast - really set you up for the day. Very central location - underground and buses at the end of the road. History of Berlin museum is very close by and includes a trip to the nuclear shelter - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Flyer_dotnet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not much to look at from the outside but the interior is very nice indeed. The front desk staff are absolutely fantastic, I was very warmly welcomed when I arrived early and a room was made available to me despite being before check in time. Rooms are small but very modern and well furnished. Great bathroom, nice lcd tv's and comfortable bed. One complaint about the TV is the lack of english language television stations, there is over 100 channels but very few with anything in english. Breakfast and wifi internet are included for free, although I left too early to eat breakfast. I did use the internet though and it worked well. Very happy with the location of the hotel too, close to shops and other forms of transport. You can take the 109 bus from the airport which stops just a couple of hundred metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for little pay!”
Reviews.Author: mrmartinrandall
Reviews.Content: All the quality and comfort you expect from the Hilton chain but at cheap prices! Rooms are contemporary and stylish and well furnished. The double bed was extremely comfortable and even though the very busy metro/rail line was outside I wasn't disturbed. Excellent location within easy reach of the Zoo metro station and when it costs 3 Euro's to travel around Berlin who can grumble. Within easy reach of the Uhlandstrasse where there are ample bars/restaurants to cater for every palette. Overall a top notch stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but don't pay extra for a room with a balcony”
Reviews.Author: Rikke21
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - rooms are clean and cozy and the staff is very friendly. We paid extra for a room on the 7th floor with a balcony, but this was a waste of money, because there are no chairs so you can actually sit outside and enjoy it, so unless you like standing up don't bother to pay extra for this type of room. The hotel is very close to the trains, and they pass every 5 minutes or more, so unfortunately it is almost impossible to leave the windows open as it gets very noisy. Breakfast buffet is very good.

Reviews.Title: “So cheap I thought there'd be a catch - there are none!”
Reviews.Author: Moomin89
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 3 weeks before our trip began on Hotels.com. A room for 2 adults for 4 nights came to £244 (including free wifi and breakfast), and this was considerably cheaper than the other hotels I had looked at (and indeed the price on the hotel website) so I figured that there must be some sort of catch. However, there were none - this was a real gem. The staff were very friendly and always helpful - there was never any trouble getting hold of anybody if you needed anything. The breakfast is great - a selection of hot and cold food and you can have as much as you like. This really saved us a lot of time and money had we had to venture out to find breakfast each morning. If you've ever stayed in a Hilton hotel before it is exactly the same. The bed was comfy and the room was cleaned everyday. The only thing I did not like about the room was that the bathroom (and toilet) was only separated from the main bedroom by a very thin sliding door that didn't reach the floor or close completely.... it was liveable but it was sometimes akin to going to the toilet and leaving the door wide open.... The Ulandstrasse U-bahn is the closest station. We had a 72 hour ticket and used this station to get to and from the rest of Berlin. It maybe took about 30 minutes to get the Alexander Platz this way, so that might give you an idea that it isn't completely centralised. It is a good base for seeing all of the sights, though. Overall we would probably come back here again. We had a really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: TigerRex
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel and had a room at the top floor with a balcony. The room rather small, but nice and clean. Unfortunately was the air at the rooms rather dry - like they are almost build to air tight!!! Another minus was the shower - the water pressure was way too low. In the mornings were we really nervous about if had to spend a whole day with shampo in hair!!! This should not happen a brand new hotel. The included breakfast was okay, but nothing fancy - never the less a nice thing to have included. The location is spot on - great shopping and restaurants plus bars in the area, especially as the hotel "bar" is not serving alcohol. All in all a okay hotel, but should probably be slightly cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: YSUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights really comfortable that we don't want to leave! We arrived a bit early than usual check in time but d room is already available to check in!the room is reasonable sized clean nice deco v modern n stylish!staff are friendly!plus free breakfast n WIFI to come with! Wat u can ask for more with very reasonable prize too?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: americagirl22
Reviews.Content: I was staying here during the European Gymnastics Championships and had a lovely stay! The rooms are very comfortable and stylish The bathroom is VERY nice!! Beautiful walk-in shower..I wish my own bathroom looked this way :-) The hotel is very conveniently located between U-bahn stations: Zoologischer Garten and Uberlandstrasse. Kurfurstendam is directly behind the hotel and also the Gedachtnichtskirche is within 5 minutes of walking. I walked all the way from the hotel over the kurfurstendamm and the Avenue die 17 Juni to the brandenburger tor. It is a very nice 30 to 40 minute walk and you get to see a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, lovely staff and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: apache85
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel and I can't recommend it highly enough. The rooms are very comfortable and reasonably priced, the service provided by staff was excellent, and the location is great for accessing pubic transport. At the time of my stay there was also free WiFi, free use of the fitness centre, free use of the business centre and a (very good) free breakfast buffet. I made use of all of the amenities and was very happy with them. The only thing I felt this hotel was lacking was room service or a more extensive menu at the bar (snacks were available including light meals), but with so many restaurants nearby that was not really a problem. I will be returning to Berlin, and I will most definitely be returning to the Hampton by Hilton West Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Upyoursdk
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the "Kürfurstendamm". Some noise from the nearby trains - but with closed windows you bearly notice it. Easy transport from the airport (Tegel) with the bus 109. Booked through hotels.com Would defintely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popitsa
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter(11) stayed there and so did a couple of friends with their daughter(8). The hotel was clean and rennovated, and rooms were clean and modern. The family room, though was too small, actually all the hotel rooms are same size. So , its OK for 2 people but not for 3: There is no room free when the sofa bed is open and there is no space for clothes and suitcases. The location is near the zoo station(10 minutes walk) and close to KUF'DAm. The staff was polite and helpfull. The breakfast was rich in eggs and meat,poor in sweets(No cakes), but was served in a strange place and, when crowded(at about 9), you may not find seats next to your friends. No safe in the rooms, no mini bar, no wardobles-just hangers and 1 shelf for clothes. THe wifi was not working well. I think it is perfect for couples, but not for families, just because of the space

Reviews.Title: “On train tracks”
Reviews.Author: Aisling12376
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mother in March for 3 night, our room was right on top of train tracks which pass every 4 minutes. We asked to be moved as this was a leisure break and we did not feel the need to be woken at 6am by a train. We were told no rooms were available and the guy simply hung up the phone. Little sleep each night. Room was clean yet small, breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: Toochy
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms, free breakfast and free internet included in the €79 price. What's not to love? The hotel is close to the U and S bahns and just a short walk from the zoo. The public transport system is excellent so it is easy to get to anywhere in the city, especially since the Zoological Gardens is a main hub for the public transport system. While here, you must do the The Famous Insider Walk: Hidden Berlin & ALL Main Sites. Barnaby was our guide and he was amazing. Also a must: Berlin Underworld, Tour 1 – Dark Worlds A tour through a bunker from WWII. Robin D. Williams was our guide and he was really good - smart and somber. We had a great time in Berlin - Ditsch (brand) pretzels, pizza pretzels and pretzel croissants were to die for. There is a stand at the U bahn station at the Zoo Gardens both above and below ground.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at great price”
Reviews.Author: avrasou2
Reviews.Content: I considered booking this hotel after reading these reviews and i'm glad i did. The hotel is very easy to find, especially if you come from the Tegel airport (Bus line 109). Bus and U Bahn stops were very convenient for travelling around the city. The room was great, nice bed with extra pillows and tea/coffee facilities included (but no frills). I have to say though, that at first we were given a room in the first floor facing the back yard - bad view and a problematic bathroom door that didn't close completely. The reception staff was very polite and provided us a better room at a higher floor. Breakfast was good, with many healthy options, but i would prefer more "sweet" products, pastries etc :) All in all, great stay at a great price, would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk, as good as in any hotel I have stayed in, if not the best. I wouldn't normally go for a chain, and Berlin does seem to have a lot of interesting independent hotels, but I didn't have time to look into them and the special offer on here was just too good to overlook. Location is good, on the Tegel side of town, x9 goes to zoo station, so does 109 but it also stops at the end of the street first (next to the u bahn so easy to see) and it's a very short walk to the hotel. Hotel is new and well designed, good bathroom and decent sized bedrooms, with storage space, a desk, and two great luxuries, a sofa and a kettle ! Breakfast is included, it's not the best - but it's free and it's a far better start to the day than to either not eat or spend a fortune on a paid for breakfast, it does get busy though so don't leave it too late. I assume internet is included, but I used one of the free computers in the lobby. Next time bmi have £99 flights to Berlin, I'll book one and book a room here too.

Reviews.Title: “if you like to see the trains at 10 meters from your room, go for it :-(”
Reviews.Author: besimple
Reviews.Content: I stay for 4 nights at the Hampton Berlin to visit Berlin. Location: The Location itself is in a nice area, the only issue are the trains which one pass every 4 min, so if you like quite nights, don't stay there. Room: Beds are very comfortable, be careful, no safety box or mini bar in your room. As you can see with the pictures, they never cleaned the head of the bed. Breakfast: There is a buffet breakfast, I have to say that is good, the only isue is that the staff is not quick enough to refull the buffet, so no more pancakes for a while, no more fruits, no more ham... Staff: Well, not very friendly sometimes a little rude. Wifi: very nice wifi connection from your room :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a good location near the Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: LincolnSquiggly
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 night with Expedia for a bargain price of £210 each, which included scheduled flights from Heathrow. Hotel proved easy to find. take 109 bus from Tegel which stops on Ku'damm at junction with Uhlandstrasse. Hotel is a three minute walk just under the rail bridge. Don't take the airport express bus as this doesn't stop at Uhlandstrasse and you'd need to double back from the Zoo Garten station by bus or tube. We were given room 504, which was actually a disabled access room - there's one on each floor. According to the floor plan these rooms are about 50% bigger than others so we had plenty of space. I agree with previous reviews concerning the unlockable sliding glass bathroom door which might be an issue for non-intimate travelling companions, though having been married for 30 years plus it certainly wasn't an issue for us. All the staff were friendly and efficient, without exception, and the free internet access was a bonus, and never failed. Never had any problems at breakfast, where seats were always available and food in plentiful supply. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area. We ate at Gasthaus Krombach and Marjellchen, both of which are reviewed on this site and at both we ate very well. We also found Restaurant San Marino on Savigny Platz, not far from the hotel. There can't be many places in Berlin where you can enjoy a decent four course meal with a choice of eight different main courses for 12 euros, though on Fridays and Saturdays the deal only applies before 7pm. Well worth a visit - which we did twice.

Reviews.Title: “Some thoughts for American travelers to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property, with a great breakfast service, good staff and an ideal location ... BUT (and there is always a "but"): The American tourist will want to consider a few details before booking this property. First, we Americans tend to be more modest than our European counterparts; this is simply stated as fact - the bathroom doors in the rooms here are sliding (frosted) glass doors. They do not necessarily close all the way, and if you are traveling with someone other than a spouse or intimate companion, it can be a bit awkward. Second, is the lack of a 110v outlet anywhere in the room; most Hilton properties in Europe provide at least one outlet (often in the bathroom, labeled as a shaver outlet, but it will most always suffice for cell phone charging etc). This property does not offer that amenity, so please be sure you have your converter and adaptor. Third, this is the only International Hilton property I have ever visited which does NOT offer currency exchange. So, admittedly, these are all ethnocentric issues, however Hilton does largely cater to US tourists. On the flip side, the staff speaks English exceptionally well, are accommodating, and the surroundings pleasant. The rooms are smaller than Hampton rooms you might encounter in the US, and the parking is by reservation (we found that out the hard way). There is a "Park Haus" just down Kantstrasse a couple of blocks, although it is more expensive than the parking at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: tomandbridie
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel great value for money .well positioned for tourist trade.hotel appeared full to capacity most nights.would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton comfort for a small price in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: noghri
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn in Berlin is a new hotel, perfectly located and offering all the confort you may expect from a (more expensive) Hilton. This Hampton is a good mix of the best practices you can found at Hilton Garden Inn hotels (such as the free wifi) and the perfect rooms you can found in Hilton's. Breakfast is really great (but avoid the 9AM peak in the breakfast room). Soundproofing of the rooms is perfect. Hotel is ideally located near several subway accesses and S-Bahn station. Bus from Berlin Tegel airport is stopping almost next door. Great shopping around and excellent restaurants (I do recommend the Capone pizzeria on Ku'Damm street, Lubitsh restaurant and Ottenthal restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “The best Hampton Inn I've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: safmath
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great breakfast, and awesome rooms. I will definitely stay there in future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MIBDK
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Friday to Sunday on a short break trip to Berlin. Got a bargain price from one of the booking sites. Hotel was well located only minutes away from U-bahn station Uhlandstrasse and Bahnhoff Zoo which made public transport very easy. There are lots of good places to eat in the sorrunding area. Breakfeast area were a bit crowded after eight in the morning, so the advise is to get up early. The staff had a hard time keeping the breafeast buffet filled up! WIFI is free of charge and worked very well. Parking your car is easy, there are lots of parkinghouses in the area at a 24 hour rate of 12-16 EUR. All in all a pleasant stay, and would definately recommend others to stay at the Hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “perferct”
Reviews.Author: Tone31
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this very nice hotel with our 13years old teenagers. The hotel has a perfect location for shightseeing and shopping. Very close to both U-bahn and the train. It is very delicate and clean, good breakfast, the rooms are very nice with very good beds (I've problems with my back) and the train very close to our room didn't desturb us at all! If we're gooing back to Berlin, I would stay at this hotel again! For sure!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_fer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a really nice stay. We were surprised how nice it was for how much we paid (around €59 per night). We had a room that was far away from the side close to the train tracks. When the window was open we could easily hear the trains going by, but with it closed we couldn't hear a thing. We had a room with a queen sized bed with a chair. The room was a good size for European standards. Very clean. There was a desk, tea and coffee in the room, a closet with iron board and iron, and a TV which received a lot of international channels. Free wifi internet in room. About a day went by where we didn't have internet due to modem problems. The bathroom had only a shower, and was very clean. My only complaint would be the bathroom door. It was a sliding frosted glass door which served either as the closet door, or the bathroom door (slide it to the left and it's for the closet, to the right and it's for the bathroom). This meant that you couldn't lock the bathroom door and it didn't really close completely, which made for less privacy. The breakfast buffet was really nice and a great way to start the day. They had everything from rolls and cheese, to pancakes and scrambled eggs, to yogurt and fruit. It was also included in the price of the room. The location of the hotel is near the Zoo Station, which made it easy to connect to pretty much anywhere in the city, using the U-bahn (metro), S-bahn (above ground train), or the regular RE trains. It was a bit far from where most of the sight seeing is, but considering what we got and what we paid, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: boulderbanana
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel- near the Tiergarten and some great shopping. The parking garage was 12 euros a day, not bad for the area. Staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. We really liked the breakfast buffet- hard to find a free breakfast at other hotels in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LjoJo
Reviews.Content: Great Location only metres from Kurfürstendamm and Savignyplatz. Very friendly and efficient staff, good breakfast. Nice, clean rooms - only fault, there being no bathtub, even though shower is very good, one misses the possibility to have a nice long bath after a hectic day! Minimalistic furniture - could have had a drawer or two to put things in. Free wifi is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: globalwanderer60
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel, very convenient, great restaurants nearby. Took a room to inside court away from the elevated train tracks, no problem sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Great new Hotel and Service, worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: tinyhunter
Reviews.Content: this hotel is new and the service is really excellent! The rooms are clean, quiet and very comfortable. We had a room with balcony and it was next to the S-Bahn, still we could not hear the trains drive by. The staff was very very friendly, to a certain extend better than in a 5 star hotel I had staid at already. The Breakfast is a bit getting used to, but even at 9:30 there was still space for 2 people to sit down. It seemed everyone was going at 9:00 to breakfast even though it is always from 6-10. The price is great and we had a really good stay, with nothing to complain about. WiFi is for free and worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: poppy2805
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on Thursday for a 3 night stay after booking it 3 weeks ago. We booked it directly with the Hilton as it was actually cheaper than using a booking site. LOCATION - this was spot on. I had stayed in Berlin before so knew roughly where we wanted to be. This was on the corner of the Ku'damm and Ullandstrasse whcih is the last stop on the U1. We generally walked to either the Zoo U Bahn or Ku'damm on as it was only approx 10 mins walk. RECEPTION/BAR - check in was very efficient and friendly. Free use of desk-top pcs in the hotel reception, bar was much cheaper than other places too! ROOM - Room was great, decent sized room with double bedroom, TV, arm chair, bathroom and wardrobe. Dont bother taking toiletries as they provide them and also a hair-dryer too. The only slight grumble I had was that the pillows were far too soft!!! BREAKFAST - During the whole time we were there we hardly saw any other guests however they all seemed to appear at breakafast! Very very busy. Food was to be expected, not great but consisted of luke warm sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, boiler eggs, pancakes, bread to toast and selection of cold meats and rolls. Tea/coffee and juices also available. All in we would definately stay here again, We paid £226 for 3 nights accommodation inc breakfast which we felt was a good deal. The only other issue we had was that the free wi-fi was turned off late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - missed the Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: half-full55
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff at this warm hotel (even at -18C outside!). Spotlessly clean despite all the snow we were tramping in, which must have been a nightmare for staff in the foyer area. A 5 minute walk from KuDamm on the U1 underground Great buffet breakfasts 6am - 10am and complementary newspapers, which certainly set you up for a day's sight-seeing. Lots of good restaurants in the immediate area, and convenient for lots of shopping if that's your thing. The only down-side was a problem with the in-room wifi which persisted throughout our 5 day stay. There were computers in the lounge area and by day 3 wifi worked there too, just not in the rooms, but I prefer not to be surrounded by other people when I'm checking emails etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location, great price. Family room 3 adults in comfort.”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: We liked the location just off the Ku-dam. The hotel is new and the room was immaculate. The rate includes breakfast and wifi which worked well. Staff friendly. Sound proofing excellent. Beds comfortable. AC/heating silent and accurate. Family room had 1 queen size bed and one double sofa bed. Bedlinens high quality. Only gripe that the bathroom door is a sliding frosted glass door that doesn't give as much privacy as I would like. The rate for 3 people including breakfast and internet is a travel bargain. I would certainly stay again. In fact we did extend our stay by a day.

Reviews.Title: “New and a great bargin”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: I took a short weekend trip to Berlin for a visit. this Hampton is definitely head and shoulders above the typical US Hampton, being closer to a Hilton than an Hampton. I suppose that's a reason to call it Hampton by Hilton rather than a Hampton Inn. To start with, it is a short 10-15 minute walk from the Zoologisher Garten U - S Stop where the X-9 express bus from Tegel Airport terminates. the location is a block from the famous Ku'Damm street with up scale shopping, restaurants and even a BMW showroom on the corner. The staff is simply excellent in every regard from addressing me by name at all times to doing superb bar service. All speak excellent English for those visitors who do not have a command of German. Being right next to a main line of the S-Bahn as well as main line trains was not noticeable. The noise that reached my 7th floor room when a train passed was comparable the hum of a home central air conditioning fan and did not disturb me at all. My corner room was "the Best of the House" according to the staff and I would agree being very large and having a wrap around balcony. Since the temperature was between 15 and 30 degrees during my stay, I did not use it much but I venture it is pleasant in the summer. the room was comfortable with a desk, couch, easy chair in addition to the very comfortable bed. The bath was spacious with a shower only (no tub). I would have liked soap bars vs the gels provided but that is a minor issue. My rate of 62 Euros was an outstanding bargain. So much so, I canceled my later reservations for the Ritz-Carlton Berlin since i could not possibly gotten much more for the additional 140 Euros per night that stay would have cost me.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: siobhanNewry
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Berlin we stayed in this lovely central hotel. It was just off the main shopping street in the west off the city. It was very central to everything. There were lovely restaurants and bars within a 3 minute walk. The rooms were spotless and the staff couldn't do enough to help. The bar in the hotel is basic but a lovely place to relax after a long hard day sightseeing and shopping. The breakfast was lovely and plentiful. Would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully surprised and impressed”
Reviews.Author: calumc
Reviews.Content: For a small hotel that I'd not heard of before, I was impressed with their facilities and services for a bargain price tag. Clean and modern room, friendly and helpful staff. Easy walking from zoo bus terminal / train station, which is a easy and quick bus trip from Tegal airport. Breakfast was sufficient though not as grand as some nearby German 5 star hotels. Gym was very limited, wireless internet was included and just sufficient for a skype voice call. Will gladly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You know what you get :)”
Reviews.Author: Tingeling
Reviews.Content: This is part of the Hampton/Hilton portifolio, so you know what to expect if you have visited any Hampton-hotels earlier. I was very pleased. It's a nice hotel, reasonably priced and with a good location. I stayed on the 6th floor and had a room in the rear. You should be aware of the trains running literally just outside the hotel and if you're a light sleeper, ask for a room in the back. I slept well. However, I had some friends that stayed in a room facing the S Bahn, but they were not affected by this at all. If this doesn't bother you, I have no problem recommending this hotel. I'll gladly go back myself :)

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, well priced”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here in November 2010. The prepaid room rate was E66 per night. Getting there: the hotel website provides great detail on driving but little on public transport. From Berlin Schönefeld Airport you would take the RE7 train to Zoologischer Garten station. From Berlin Tegel you take the 109 bus to the corner of Uhlandstrasse and K'damm (at the Uhlandstrasse U bahn (U1) station) and walk 200 metres North past the BMW auto dealership. The hotel is next to the main east-west S bahn line. In terms of getting around Berlin, this hotel is very well placed. It is equidistance to Zoo Garten, Savignyplatz and Uhlandstrasse stations. Decor is modern, accented in places by photographs of Old Berlin. The staff are friendly and multilingual. Wireless internet access was free, there were also terminals in the foyer with Internet access. There is no pool, parking is available downstairs. There is a gym on the lower level - this has treadmills, an eliptical trainer, horizontal bike, free weights, TV screen but no vertical bike or rowing machine - there are toilets but no showers adjacent. There is no outlook from the gym, some may find clautrophobic. i did not eat at the hotel basically because of options in the locale. Several of the top 10 restaurants in the city are within blocks; there are several new restaurants being developed under the arches of the S bahn that would warrant a try. There is Quasimodo's jazz club, small live theater and many buildings with amazing architectural details to look at. The ground floor of the hotel has extensive areas on the ground floor to seat, eat and drink. The rooms are a reasonable size. I had a queen bed and fold out sofa. The bathroom had a good shower but no bathtub. The only issue i had in the room I was on the inside and could not hear the S bahn trains. So what's wrong the the place? Its new and bit sterile - more pictures of old Berlin would help warm it up. In the rooms there is very little storage space - a standard closet with a sliding door and no in room safe. In this neighbourhood there are several options for hotels - Savoy, NH etc. I would stay here again, it was excellent value and I get some Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “It has all one needs for a good night (who needs more?)”
Reviews.Author: antan
Reviews.Content: If in Berlin for a business or meeting or extensive sightseeing and out of the hotel much of the day this place offers all one needs - good value for money. Location near the hub of `old` West berlin in a neighborhood thats a bit shoddy by now (Banhof Zoo, and surroundings) it is extremely convenient (S-Bahn to Schoenefeld, Sub way, airport tegel bus). Brandnew (I understand they only opened last month) it is spotlessly clean, and efficient. It has no `extras ` one would not really need and usually pay for in vein in so many other places. It has a gym (sort of) but that one has (surprizingly) no showers, and few equipment only - perhaps they are still `installing` it and I did not see the final outcome yet. It has free breakfast (but on a weekend it can be VERY crowded at breakfast.) It has free internet terminals in the lobby - another plus. And the best: it has superb sleeping quality (if you stay away from rooms that face the elevated s-Bahn line RIGHT NEXT to the buidling!). Definitely a new choice for me in berlin!,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near KuDamm”
Reviews.Author: kyhoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on a weekend outing at the new Hampton. The rooms were spacious with modern amenities and décor. There was, however, no room safe. The bath was also spacious and modern. The rooms faced out onto the S-Bahn tracks, but the hotel obviously invested in well-insulated windows, because we barely heard the trains when they passed by only a few meters from the windows (see pictures). We certainly slept well and had no problems with noise. The only negative that we suffered all weekend was the breakfast arrangement. The rooms were overcrowded, and the staff was overwhelmed. Someone actually stole my chair while I was getting coffee. But I think this is probably just growing pains for a newly opened hotel, and everything else was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Svanfolk
Reviews.Content: Location is great for getting around Berlin. New, clean and tidy. Totally non-smoking hotel. We stayed here for 4 nights and were not disappointed. Breakfast can be somewhat chaotic if the hotel is full - badly designed layout. Hotel is located next to a railway line, so the rooms on the side can be noisy. The sound-proofing is good, so as long as you keep the window closed it doesn't disturb too much. However, in the summer it would not be possible to have the window open - so hopefully, the aircon is good and quiet. Otherwise request a quiet room - the road at the front is not too busy, so if there are no rooms available at the back, a front room would be preferable to a side room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cioccolato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights late September. The hotel was newly opened. They have modern interior designs. Positive : LOCATION! close to Kudamm, close to Zoo station, close to Uhlandstrasse station, lots of bus connection, no heavy traffic outside. Room size is fine for our taste, not too big not too little. Amenities are great for a 3,5 star hotel. Bathroom is also modern and comfortable. Bed size (140x90cm) is okay, could be bigger though. Lots of choices for breakfast, both warm and cold breakfast were available. Free internet in the lobby. Room price is excellent for a hotel this class and the location. What could probably be considered as not so positive is the VERY close proximity to train rail, it is right next to the hotel building. And trains sure passes by frequently. But I guess the building is quite soundproof so it actually was not so loud inside our room. It did not bother us much so perhaps it won't bother you either :) Conclusion : an excellent hotel, would definitely stay here again should we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PEPASA
Reviews.Content: super very nice modern hotel!excellent location, cleany rooms. very new hotel, opened in Sep. 2010

Reviews.Title: “as efficient as can be”
Reviews.Author: Gili_Wolff
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located near one of the S-Bahn stations. literally minutes away from many of the city's points of interest. very good choice if you are looking for a place to stay in if you are visiting for the berlin marathon or bussiness. new. clean. great location. friendly staff. comfortable beds. nice breakfast. wi-fi. highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton by Hilton Berlin City West
HotelInfo.Address: Uhlandstrasse 188-189, 10623 Berlin, Germany
